loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. Maribel is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Maribel requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts, gasoline and do maintenance on her motorcycle.

Maribel has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, gasoline and do maintenance on her motorcycle.

loans.name: Floremia

texts.en:
Floremia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her rice business.

Floremia has been in this business for 2 years. Floremia earns additional income from seaweed culture.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosivella

texts.en:
Rosivella works hard to support her family. Rosivella is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets.

Rosivella has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Rosivella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Roselia

texts.en:
Roselia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Roselia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Eucabeth

texts.en:
Eucabeth is dedicated to her family and to her farm work. Her tenacity and perseverance have allowed her to get ahead and overcome various obstacles that have presented themselves along the way. 

Fifteen years ago she started farming. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. 

Eucabeth is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. 

Kenya's Nyamira area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals.  Eucabeth could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Eucabeth, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing.  Eucabeth believes this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. 

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Eucabeth to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.  Support Eucabeth’s business and make her life better with a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 34-year-old divorced woman with 4 children. All her children currently attend school. She lives in a rural setting with her family. She deals in agriculture primarily growing coffee, bananas and passion fruits to support her family. She supplements her family income with retail trade and fish mongering. She works four days a week on her gardens and each day she works for 6 hours.

Juliet started her farming business in 2011 with the aim of getting money to support her children after divorcing her husband. She has acquired this loan in order to buy fertilizers, passion seeds and herbicides for her plantations. Her clients are neighbors and traders from surrounding towns and her dream is to educate all her children and to expand her businesses. Her biggest challenges are lack of enough capital, pests and diseases, climatic changes and lack of a stable market for agricultural products in her area. She describes herself as a very hard working woman.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin hails from Koibatek, located in the remote Kapsowar area of Kenya. Kapsowar's high altitude affords it regular rainfall and a cold climate, which makes it a suitable location for growing commercial crops such as maize and tea. Most constituents like Benjamin also raise dairy animals for milk products. In addition, to ease the transportation of produce to and from the market, Benjamin has invested in an Indian motorcycle, which provides him with extra income from providing transportation services to other members of his community.

Benjamin is seeking a loan of 65,000 Kenyan shillings. He will use the principal to buy wires, which he will use to fence his property. Fencing his farm will have several benefits for his family, which include avoiding disputes with neighbours, preventing farm animals from destroying his crops and having a sense of security.

loans.use: to buy a fence for his farm

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.en:
Navbahor is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She lives in small village. She is married and has five children. 

She was born into a family of agrarians, so she well knows agriculture and keeping livestock. She is good-mannered and behaves very well and, in particular, knows it is not easy to earn money for a living. 

After getting married, she wanted to have a family business in agriculture. Her husband supported her, and they plant agricultural products in rented land. The land is big enough, and it needs care. Every day Navbahor takes care off the land and her plants. 

She has appealed to IMON for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant and nurture the plantings. She hopes to have a good harvest from her plantings and then live better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant and nurture  the plantings

loans.name: Moon Group

texts.en:
Nelda, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children. Two of them are at school and one is still small. She has been a food vendor for one and a half years now.  She works from 06am to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Nelda's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase stock in her mamalishe (local restaurant) business and serve more people.  She dreams of selling soft drinks along with her mamalishe business. 

Nelda will share this loan with her loan group Moon Group which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock in her mamalishe business and serve more people.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 57 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child now at her adult age. Esterlita earns a living from her gowns and dressmaking business. She has also been engaged in the hog-fattening business for eight years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing these types of business activities. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional three piglets and two sacks of booster feed for her hog-fattening business. Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to have her own gown boutique business.

loans.use: To purchase an additional three piglets and two sacks of booster feed

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is married and has three children. She is 45 years old and lives in Kanim, Sibutad. She earns a living offering manicure/pedicure services. She now has been in this business for about 10 years and is well known for the nice quality of services she offers.  Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable with a net profit of about PHP 2,500 per month. Elvie is seeking a PHP 14,900 loan. She would like to use the loan to buy additional manicure and pedicure sets. In her previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. Elvie is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy additional manicure and pedicure sets.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is from Oroquieta. She operates a motor transport business with her husband as driver. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. Rebecca wants to live comfortably with her house so she applied for a loan from PMPC. This loan is intended to buy plywood and nails and pay for carpentry. She is now on her way to repair and expand her house.

loans.use: to buy plywood and nails and pay for carpentry.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en: Pastora joined PMPC in the year 2011 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education it offers. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending PMPC's various programs and services. She has a small piece of farm land near her home. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 6,000. This loan is intended to buy farm inputs to start growing her vegetable and crops farming business.  Pastora dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to start growing her vegetable and crops farming business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Zenaida has been pig fattening for two years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Clarito

texts.en:
Clarito is 64 years old, married and has four children.

Clarito is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Clarito has been this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Maria Ada

texts.en:
Maria Ada is 41 years old, married, and has one child who is still in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Maria Ada has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Norma

texts.en:
Ma. Norma is 65 years old and widow with seven children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ma. Norma has been farming sugarcane for 26 years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with five children who are all currently attending schools. He lives in rural setting with his family and another four children who are orphans that he takes care of. He deals in small-scale agriculture, mainly growing coffee, passion fruits and bananas to support his family and meet financial obligations. He supplements his family income with a motorcycle taxi. He works six days a week on his gardens and each day he works for 7 hours.

He started the farming business with the aim of raising money to support his family, as its demands were becoming endless. He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy a new motorcycle, which he will use to ferry people at a cost, thus increasing his income base.

His clients are traders from surrounding trading centers and his dream is to accumulate wealth for his children’s education.  His biggest challenges are limited capital, pests, diseases, and price changes for agricultural products, which are not stable. With the loan boost, he will overcome some of these challenges. He appreciates the support granted to him by the Kiva lenders. He is a hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his passion fruit garden.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 33 years old and married with one child, who is in school. Marissa works very hard to provide for her family.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, soft drinks and personal care products.

Marissa has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, soft drinks and personal care products

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 52 years old, is married and has five children. One of her children is in school.

Ma. Luz is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Luz has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Luz has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed four times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
With a smile and a big heart, Milka has had a lot of customers since she started farming 45 years ago. She is a smallholder farmer based in Gitareni village in Central Kenya. 

She owns a one-acre piece of land where she grows different varieties of crops and keeps poultry. She has also planted over 400 trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. Not only does the land provide her with capital for her business but also with a home for her family. She is blessed to have eight children with her husband, to whom she has stayed married for 45 years! 

Milka is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals she is seeking serve to replenish her stock for food and business. The demand for cereals in Chuka, only a few kilometers from Milka's home, is rising. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. 

By placing herself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, she will enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. She is very pragmatic and considers herself more hardworking than others. 

Your loan will directly elevate Milka's livelihood. She strives to give her children a better life than the tough upbringing she grew up in.  Help this enterprising woman with a clear vision in life!

loans.use: to purchase cereals to plant and seeds to sell

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda is a 36-year-old married woman who has six children. She lives in a populated area and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruit from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows his customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 

Farkhanda's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruit every day and considers them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruit. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can sell the maximum amount of fruit until evening and get the maximum reward for his efforts. 

Farkhanda applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more fruits and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits for her husband to resell

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 43-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been manufacturing the bearings of vehicles using dies for many years.

He buys steel scrap material from the market and heats it to high temperature for melting. The raw material becomes melted under high temperature. He then injects it into the dies for giving it a specific shape. In this way, he manufactures the bearings, sells them in the market, and makes enough income to contribute to his family's livelihood.

Kalsoom has seven children, and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well.

She is in her third loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. Currently, she has requested a loan to buy more raw materials for manufacturing so that her son can increase his sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

Kalsoom is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for her son's business of manufacturing vehicle bearings.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Antonia is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. Recently, Antonia requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale and plans to take in swine production for her business expansion. Someday, Antonia hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn has always dreamed of opening and running her own shop, buying and selling various footwear to support her four children. She used her loan to buy additional footwear items to sell to increase inventory and her sales. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to buy additional footwear items to sell to increase inventory and her sales.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica thanks you for your generosity because her previous loan helped her grow her sales from business. That loan enabled her to purchase additional grocery products to increase her product inventory. Her business profits were used to provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Monica is very confident that she will prosper through her business. She hopes that you will trust her again and lend her an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will be used to purchase additional stock, including groceries, toiletries, and beverages. By offering more items for sale, her customers will likely buy more products. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Monica to sustain her family's needs.

Monica aims to grow and expand her variety store through all her hard work and perseverance. She pray always that her family will have good health and life. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah earns a living offering manicure and pedicure services.  She is 28 years old, single, and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta.  She is now well known for the nice quality of services she offers.  She has already purchased some new manicure sets and is able to save from it.  Her services are self-sustainable and have become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 3,000 per month.  

Deborah is seeking a PHP 3,000 loan.  She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for foot spa services. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in few months. Deborah is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase special items for foot spa services.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 66 years old and lives in Tamban, Baliangao. She is married and has six children.

Lourdes has a "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business and earns approximately 15,000 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to buy stocks in bulk for her business. 

Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy used clothes in bulk

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Lelanie

texts.en:
Lelanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lelanie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Lelanie has been in this business for ten years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Twenty years ago, Alice started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Nyamira, a remote rural town in Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. 

Although she makes a profit through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit so she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and to purchase more poultry. Through the loan she will have an easier time milking her cow and feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and prevents them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Increased poultry will allow her to satisfy the ready market for eggs that is in her village. Alice believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk and egg production. She will save the money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Alice waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit and purchase more poultry

loans.name: Lucia Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Lucía se dedica a la costura hace más de 4 años. Es madre soltera de un hijo al cual logra mantener con el trabajo que desempeña como costurera en una sastrería. Adicionalmente realiza trabajos independientes de forma esporádica. La Sra. Lucía no tiene un ingreso fijo, sino que recibe pagos por trabajos terminados, ella tiene un claro impulso de superarse, muestra de ello es el esfuerzo que realizó para capacitarse en costura (corte y confección) para perfeccionar sus habilidades en el "Centro de Capacitación de la Cruz Roja Boliviana" y en " La Dirección General de Adultos del Servicio Departamental de Educación". Con estas habilidades que perfeccionó, la señora Lucía piensa independizarse y emprender su propio taller de costura, con tal motivo necesita ayuda y solicita un crédito para comprar telas y maquinas de costura de esta forma podrá incrementar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucía has been sewing for more than four years. She is a single mother with a child who she supports through her work as a seamstress at a tailoring shop. In addition, she works independently by taking on sporadic jobs. Sra. Lucía does not have a steady income since she only receives payment for her finished work. She has an obvious drive to succeed, as demonstrated by the effort she made to obtain sewing training at the Center for Training at the Bolivian Red Cross and from the General Directorate for Adult Services through the Department of Education in order to hone her skills.

With her skills perfected, Sra. Lucía plans to become independent and establish her own sewing workshop. On this occasion, she needs assistance and is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics and a sewing machine. This will help her to increase her earnings and eventually improve the quality of life for herself and her child.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 53 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Juanita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Juanita has been in this business for 34 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 55 years old and has 10 children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Estrella is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Saraina

texts.es: SARAINA: Es originaria de la comunidad de Saupuka, que se localiza a 8 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia mayagna, tiene 50 años de edad. Trabaja como docente de escuela primaria. Ante la dificultad de no tener garantías materiales, para acceder al crédito formó parte de un grupo solidario, por un periodo de 3 años, ahora que ha ido mejorando sus ingresos, ha ido adquiriendo bienes materiales como electrodomésticos que ya puede poner en garantía, por lo que se ha desligado del Grupo Solidario y está solicitando su primer crédito individual para instalarle las ventanas y puertas a su vivienda de tambo y madera, que con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado a construirla. Ella y su marido sueñan con tener una casa de concreto que tenga mejores condiciones para sus hijos y sobre todo mayor seguridad.
texts.en: Saraina is a native of the Saupuka community, which is located 8 kilometers from Waspam.  She is 50-years old and is ethnically Mayagnan.  Saraina works as a teacher in a primary school.  Because of the difficulties she had in not having any collateral, she joined a communal bank for three years.  This gave her access to a loan.  Now that her income is improving and she has acquired assets, such as electrical appliances, she can put up a guarantee on her loan.  As such Saraina has separated from her communal bank and is requesting her first individual loan.  She wants to install windows and doors in her stilted house made of wood. It has taken a large effort, but little by little, construction has begun.  Saraina and her husband dream of having a concrete house so they could offer their children better living conditions and, most importantly, greater security.

loans.use: to install windows and doors in her house made of wood that is on stilts.

loans.name: Janett

texts.en:
This is Janett. She has been managing her own food stall for many years now. Previously, she had a loan amounting to PHP 25,000, and she was able to pay it back faithfully. She used the loan to purchase more raw materials needed in her recipes. The profit she got has really helped her, most especially, in terms of sustaining her family's needs.

She would respectfully like to avail herself of another loan worth PHP 25,000, which she will use to purchase more quantity of ingredients needed for her food stall. Surely, this will help her improve her profit in no time. By now, she sincerely lets you know her thanksgiving for your deep-rooted generosity and kindness.

Janett dreams of someday being successful with the current inventory. By then, she will be able to earn enough for her dream house. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more quantity of ingredients needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Marmelita

texts.en:
Marmelita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marmelita is 50 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Marmelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Marmelita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 39 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell such as soap, chips, noodles, etc. Belen has been running her business for three years, and also earns an income from food vending and buying and selling dry goods.

Belen has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell such as soap, chips, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 51 years old, married, and has nine children. Three of her children are in school. Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Marilyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es casado tiene 27 años de edad y dos hijas, trabaja en una constructora desde hace 5 años. Su esposa necesita una cirugía ya que se le encontró un tumor benigno el cual esta obstaculizando su visión y estéticamente es desagradable.
Hace dos años le realizaron una cirugía para retirarlo y le volvió aparecer, por el momento no cuenta con los recursos económicos para realizar la cirugía a su esposa.
texts.en:
The borrower is 27 years old and has two daughters. He has been working in construction for the past five years. His wife needs surgery because she has a benign tumor that is obstructing her vision and is aesthetically unpleasant.

Surgery was performed two years ago to remove the tumor, but it has since returned. At the moment, the borrower does not have the financial resources to pay for his wife’s surgery.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's eye surgery.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 48 years old and married with two children. With both her children still in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 33-year-old married mother of three children. Two years ago she opened her own grocery store business to support her beloved husband in increasing their family's income and developing their living. Samah's children are enrolled in a private school because she and her husband work hard to provide them with the best education ever so that they can benefit from a brighter future.

Samah's business is going on just fine, but it's barely enough to cover her family's increasing needs. For this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to increase her business merchandise with special-offer products that will attract more customers and increase her income.

Samah's grocery store needs a lot of financial support so that she can reply to most of her customer's requests. She hopes that in the future she can expand her working place to a wider supermarket.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special-offer products that will attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.name: Sano

texts.en:
Sano is a hospitable woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. Now she is living in small village. She is a widow, and has four children. She alone raises and feeds her family. 

After her husband’s death, Sano started to do business in order to feed her family. It is hard for her to both raise her children and do business. She buys and sells women's clothing and bags. 

Sano is asking for a loan to buy an assortment of new-season clothing. She hopes she will have a permanent client base and gain enough profits from her business to feed her family so that her children are not in need of anything.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of new-season clothing.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is a 47-year-old married mother of three children who works in her grocery shop to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of her beloved kids. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who succeeded throughout the years to gain loyal customers.
 
Today, Nabila is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business and increase her merchandise with new requested products to satisfy her customers' needs. She also wants to renovate her house through buying new furniture to make it a healthier place for her family.

Nabila hopes to expand her business in the future and attract new customers to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new requested products and to buy new furniture for her house

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan está estudiando la carrera de criminalística y ciencias forenses, comenta que está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder ser un profesional útil para las demás personas. 
Juan es una persona muy luchadora que quiere ser alguien en la vida y también con su profesión poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder estar más cerca de cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Juan is studying for a degree in Criminology and Forensic Sciences. He says that he is doing his best to become a professional who is useful to other people.

Juan is a determined individual who wants to make something out of his life. He also wants to help his family through his profession.

Juan is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees. This will help him get closer to accomplishing his goal.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Marining

texts.en:
Marining is 35 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Marining works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marining has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. In the future she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Divina Josie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Divina Josie works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from fish vending. Divina Josie is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more frozen food to sell through her food vending business.

Divina Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 44-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

Rowena has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elwin

texts.es: Es un joven jovial, de la comunidad de Saupuka, que se localiza a 8 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia mayagna, tiene 29 años de edad, casado, tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Trabaja como docente de educación primaria. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de tambo y madera, sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para terminar de construir la estructura de madera Es por eso que solicitan su primer préstamo para comprar: madera cepillada, clavos, madera y cubrir costos de transporte y mano de obra. El sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
He is a young, jovial person from the community of Saupuka, which is located 8 kilometers from the town of Waspam. He belongs to the Mayagna ethnic group, is 29 years old, married, and has two younger children. He works as a primary school teacher. 

With great effort, he has slowly begun construction on his home, but his salary cannot cover the expenses required to finish the wooden structure. This is why he is seeking his first loan to buy wood, nails, cover transport costs, and costs of labor.

His dream is to have a nice house, with better conditions and security, and better environment for his children.

loans.use: to finish building the wooden structure for his house

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela tiene 23 años, vive con sus padres y dos hermanas, estudió la carrera de Nutricionista porque siempre le gustó desde pequeña y aspira trabajar con niños especialmente, ya termino su carrera de nutrición.
Hoy está estudiando el postgrado en Didáctica universitaria y está en proceso su titulación, ella quiere poder enseñar en las universidades es por eso que estudia esto.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus gastos de titulación, y con ello poder cubrir este gasto que tiene que cubrir.
texts.en:
Mariela is 23 years old and lives with her parents and two sisters. She studied nutrition because she always liked it since she was young, and she especially aspires to work with children. She has already finished her studies of nutrition.

Today she is studying postgraduate university teaching and is in the process of her degree. She wants to teach in universities and this is why she is studying this.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the expenses of her certification, and thereby be able to cover the expenses that she needs to cover.

loans.use: to pay for graduation expenses.

loans.name: Jenit

texts.en:
Jenit is 30 years old, married, and has two children to provide for. She does a vegetable garden to help her husband with their living.

To increase their family income, she decided to take a loan to buy a variety of seedlings for her vegetable garden, for the purpose of having more vegetables to sell in the market.

Jenit wants in the future to have her own lot for her garden.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seedlings for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: EL ESTA CASADO DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS SIN EMBARGO SU ESPOSA HA TENIDO PROBLEMAS PARA EMBARAZARSE, ACTUALMENTE Y LUEGO DE UN TRATAMIENTO ESTAN ESPERANDO SU PRIMER HIJO. EL EMBARAZO ES DE ALTO RIESGO Y POR EL MOMENTO NO CUENTA CON RECURSOS PARA SOLVENTAR EL GASTO YA QUE FUE REAJUSTADO DE SU EMPLEO DONDE  ERA BIEN REMUNERADO Y EN SU ACTUAL TRABAJO EL INGRESO ES MAS BAJO
texts.en:
The borrower has been married for several years and his wife has had problems with getting pregnant. After she underwent treatment, they are now expecting their first child.

However, her pregnancy is high-risk and they do not have the resources at the moment to cover the expenses. His high-paying job had been downgraded and he currently earns a much lower income in his current position.

loans.use: to pay the expenses related to his wife's high-risk pregnancy.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is 43 years old and married with five children.  With three of her children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Rocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Rocelyn would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with ten children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling fertilized duck eggs.

Gloria dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn engages in making nipa (feather-leaved palm used as roofing on native houses) shingles. She lives in Javier, Leyte. She is a mother of a 19-year-old son. She has been engaged in making and selling of nipa shingles for three years now.  She is facing a financial crisis, and she is in need of funds to support her existing nipa business.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase more nipa shingles. In this way, Marilyn could now purchase more materials that would help improve her current business. 

She  dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase more nipa shingles

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 36-year-old married mother of three children. Four years ago she opened her own grocery store in her village to support her husband in covering their family's increasing living needs. This was after she took the necessary experience through being employed in a supermarket for enough time.

Iman works hard to cover her children’s educational expenses to make sure that they will benefit from a better future.

Today, and since she is working hard to develop her business and living, Iman decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car that will help her search for better-offer products and will ease her family's needs.

She is very anxious about this loan and hopes to turn her small grocery store into a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car that will help her search for better-offer products and will ease her family's needs.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa hails from the town of Javier, Leyte. She is a 24-year-old married woman with a three-year-old child. She earns a living by raising and selling hogs. Her husband is a carpenter, and his income would be a big help to defray the family's daily expenses. Marissa has been engaged in her hog-raising business for four years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feeds and other items needed for swine maintenance. This loan will truly be an essential tool with which to improve her hog-raising livelihood. It will augment Marissa's earnings and enable her to pay her obligations. With increased income, she would be able to prepare nutritious food for her child and provide better living conditions.

In the future, she is hoping that she will be able to manage her hog raising business successfully for the improvement of her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds and other items needed for swine maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a plot which he will use for brick making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for planting so as to enable him get good farm produce for selling and family consumption.

loans.name: Jamero

texts.en:
Jamero works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling mud crabs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more mud crabs to sell.

Jamero has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Jamero would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more mud crabs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the school fees of his 14-year-old boy in secondary school.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is married and works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal "buy & sell" business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Razel has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vicitacion

texts.en:
Vicitacion works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Vicitacion requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Vicitacion has been in this business for 30 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is a businesswoman from Baliangao. She has three children and her husband is a farmer.

Nellie plants variety of flowers, most of them to sell, which helps support their basic needs. She also farms cocoa land as their primary source of income.

Nellie applied for a loan to buy fertilizer for her flowers, and part of the money she will use to pay for cleaning the area of cocoa land. She is happy, helping in the position of others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for cocoa land maintenance.

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family.

Recently, Thelma requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale and plans to take in swine production for her business expansion.

Someday, Thelma hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to buy feed and animal vitamins.

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Zaalicah

texts.en:
Zaalicah has owned and operated her own souvenir shop for years now. She was able to help provide for her family through this and had successfully repaid her previous loan, used to buy additional bundles of shirts that she sells.

Zaalicah wants to have an additional source of funds to purchase more stock. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time in the amount of PHP 16,000, to buy an additional stock of souvenir shirts.

In the future, Zaalicah wants to see her souvenir business thrive more so she can continue to support the basic needs of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more souvenir shirts needed in her business.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a hardworking entrepreneur in the Philippines who does business buying and selling dried coconut meat. She also earns income from farming vegetables, rice and corn.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more dried coconut meat to sell through her "buy-and-sell" business.

Karen has been in this business for eight years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her business.

Susan has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 65 years old, and married with four children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Violeta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a veteran with a lot of experience in the field. She is humble and simple. She is very friendly with people, and has great energy to develop any crop that needs production. She is based in Kibichoi in the Thika area of Kenya.

Esther has been doing farming on her five-acre plot of land for more than a decade. She keeps a dairy cow and grows different varieties of food crops. The trees planted on the land shows how Esther is environmentally responsible.

The 39-year-old farmer is also married. She has been married for 23 years to a man who gave her three children.

Esther is seeking a loan to purchase grains. For extra income, she brokers cereals. The only way she can expand this business is by getting her hands on more grains from the farmers. To do this, she has to leverage her business and pay the debt using the returns she will get from selling the cereals.

Esther describes her childhood as difficult. It took hard work and street smarts to get her where she is today. The environment she has been exposed to has made her very cautious when approaching new business opportunities. The fact she is somewhat risk-averse makes her a favorable borrower with a sober approach on how she is going to spend and regain money. She stated that she will use the increased income to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cereals.

loans.name: Jonnebert

texts.en:
Jonnebert is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in Aloran, Philippines. 

Jonnebert has a furniture shop, making and selling various furniture items. It also offers services like wood carving and molding. He has had this business for three years. 

He requested a loan to purchase more inventory of wood to produce more varieties of furniture. Jonnebert has recently became a member of PMPC. 

In the future, Jonnebert hopes to own a furniture showroom to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of wood to produce more varieties of furniture

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata is 57 years old, happily married and blessed with five children. She lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. 

For the past two years, Liberata has been a farmer. She earns 1,500 PHP each month. 

Liberata is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Naichean Group

texts.en:
Naichean is 33 years old, a farmer, and a married woman living with her husband and her five children in Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. 

She has been a farmer since 1999. Her husband is 37, and also a farmer. Three of her children are students.

Now Naichean would like to request a loan as leader of a group of three members. She will use her portion to buy foundation parts of a latrine. This loan will provide her a hygienic living. 

In the future she is going to buy more farmland, renovate her house, and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy foundation parts of a latrine

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man aged 42 years. He has four children all going to school and he is living in a typical pastralist rural setting where he does cattle rearing and trading to earn income to meet his family obligations.

Despite the many cows, Steven has always lived in a grass thatched house because it had been the tradition. He was excited when a fellow cattle keeper started building a permanent house and when Steven inquired, the friend told him he had gotten a loan from UGAFODE. 

Steven also decided to borrow so that he can build a permanent house from the proceeds of the cattle trade. He is however challenged by the long droughts that affect the productivity of the cows.

He is requesting this loan to purchase more cows to fatten and later to sell. He said that his clients are traders from his village and those from the nearby villages.

His hope for the future is to enlarge his cattle business and build a permanent house to provide decent housing for his household.  He appreciates the work done by UGAFODE to sensitise rural communities on developmental projects and is proud to partner with Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy cattle to boost his cattle trade business

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia thought it was good fortune when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. With her desire to help the family, she raises pigs. 

Recently she requested a loan to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her hog growing. 

Aside of planning to build concrete pigpens, Flavia wishes to continue to manage her business more effectively with the support of her family. 

Someday she hopes to repair her house, and to provide her family a safe and decent living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for commercial sale and bags of feed for her hog growing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a car wash machine for washing vehicles of clients who cannot access such services within his area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks for keeping and later selling in the market when they have grown so as to earn a living from them.

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena, 43 years old, is married with five children. 

She sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for five years. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more bananas to sell. Jena has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas for retail

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en:
Lailanie is 40 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell dry goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Lailanie has been in this business for ten years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 42-year-old married mother of two children who has been running her own handmade business from her house since 2006.  She has 15 years of experience in her domain. 

Mona used to work as a photographer, but she likes to make handmade crafts and souvenirs more; that's why she worked hard on developing her talents and introducing people to her special work through exhibitions she used to and still participates in.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy new released beads and pieces, in addition to special thread and textiles necessary for her business development.

Mona hopes to open her own shop in the future, where she can display all of her productions in a well-organized way.

loans.use: To buy new released beads and pieces, in addition to special thread and textiles necessary for her business development

loans.name: Silvie

texts.en:
Silvie is a 29-year-old single lady who has 10 years of experience in female beauty needs and requests. She is a hardworking lady, well known in her region for her special talents in her domain and for encouraging set prices per provided services.

Silvie is intending to develop her business more, through an acquired youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, which she will invest in increasing her supply of beauty cosmetics and updating her necessary tools and machines requested.

This loan will help her to develop her business properly, so that she can provide several new beauty services to her customers and, in so doing, improve her income and develop her living.

loans.use: to develop her business through increasing her supply of beauty cosmetics and updating her necessary tools and machines requested

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 30-year-old married father of two children, who has been employed in a cake factory since 2002.

Bilal is well experienced in his domain, but his limited monthly income prevents him from starting his own business which he looks forward to in the future.

Today, and since he is the sole breadwinner to his family, Bilal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees, so they can benefit from a better education.

He hopes that in the future his children will find better working domains that will provide them with a better future.

loans.use: To pay his beloved children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Valentina De Jesus

texts.es: Valentina tiene 40 años de edad, se siente muy feliz por tener un techo donde poder vivir con sus hijos de las edades 18, 19 y 23 años y su compañero de vida lo cual luchan por brindarles apoyo y así poder salir adelante con dedicación y constancia en el día a día. Ella presta sus servicios domésticos desde hace varios, gracias a su perseverancia y esmero logra suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar. El techo de la vivienda de Valentina está muy debilitado y ella teme que caiga en cualquier momento, causando un accidente sobre todo con los más pequeños, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina, madera y clavos ya que desea cambiar el techo del corredor lo antes posible, ya que como se observa en la fotografía en cualquier momento puede ceder.
texts.en:
Valentina is 40 years old and feels very happy to have shelter to live with her children aged 18,19 and 23 years old and her life companion with whom she strives to provide support and get ahead with dedication and perseverance day by day. She has been offering domestic services for a number of years and thanks to her perseverance and determination manages to provide the basic necessities of the household.

The roof of Valentina house is in very poor condition and she is afraid it might fall in at any time, causing an accident especially with the little ones. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy laminated sheeting, wood and nails as she wants to change the roof of her veranda as soon as possible. As you can see in the photo it might cave in at any time.

loans.use: to buy laminated sheeting, wood and nails to replace the roof of her veranda.

loans.name: Karimkul

texts.en:
Karimkul is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1976. He is living in a rural area, where for men to do business is more common than for women because the feeders and keepers of the families are men. 

He has ten years experience in doing business. He is married and has children. He is busy in agriculture and his wife supports and helps him. He has livestock and keeps them for further selling in the animal market. 

The business that he is doing is profitable. He is planning to do his best in business until next year, and then repair the place for keeping livestock. Now, he is asking for financial support to buy calves to grow and trade. He awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy calves to grow and trade

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 55-year-old married mother of one child who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. She has been working in tailoring for 20 years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their only child. 

Zahra is an ambitious woman who has a good reputation in her region, and is well-known for her professional tailoring skills. Throughout the years, she sacrificed a lot and deprived herself in order to give her child a better life and future, as she was supporting him all the time until he traveled out of Lebanon and found the job which will change his life.

Today, Zahra is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start building her own house, for she has been a tenant for a long time. 

She hopes to expand her business more in the future to stay capable of covering the expenses of building her house.

loans.use: to start building her own house

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en:
From Sindangan, Rose Mary earns a living through her used clothing sales. She seeks to have enough inventories to continuously provide for her family. 

For her capital needs, PMPC has stood by her since the start of her business. She is happy that she is able to survive the odds of business with determination and her family as her inspiration. 

To earn more, she applied for a loan to purchase various used clothing inventories to sell.  Rose Mary hopes to live comfortably while her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase various used clothing inventories to sell

loans.name: Dayren

texts.en:
Dayren has always had enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their banana land in Tudela, Misamis Occidental and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land preparations. This will ensure that the land is ready for planting. 

Dayren knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season. In the future, Dayren hopes to buy a hauling truck for easy transport of produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Olpha

texts.en:
Olpha is 31 years old and supports five family members. She has been practicing farming for the last 10 years. The business earns her a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Olpha has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase certified seedlings for sowing in order to improve her production. 

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase certified seedlings

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Virgie has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is 35 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Rovelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rovelyn has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 49 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are presently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising a pig in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Anita has been this business for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain it. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ulice

texts.es:
Ulice es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está estudiando en  la carrera de ingeniería comercial, a la ve que estudia también trabaja, para que de esa forma pueda cubrir sus gastos.
Ulice está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida, y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ulice is from the city of Ybycuí. He is studying commercial engineering and also working at the same time so that way he can cover his expenses.
Ulice is putting forth his best effort to be able to be someone in life, and in this way to be able to help his family and his loved ones. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay tuition for his studies. With the loan he will be able to continue with his studies as he has been.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Vivien

texts.en: Vivien is gaining profit from her snack vending business in Tangub City. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from her earnings. Vivien hopes to provide her family with safe and comfortable living quarters, so she requested a loan to purchase marine plywood, nails, and plain sheet for house roofing. Vivien wishes to earn more from her business to continuously benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, nails, and plain sheet for house roofing

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Jean Alien

texts.en:
Jean Alien is 27 years old and married. She is known in their area for her small sari-sari store business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the PMPC offers.

She hopes to increase her inventory, for which reason she applied for a loan to purchase additional grocery (food and non-food) items. Jean Alien hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. She is very thankful when all her financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery (food and non-food) items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting to increase her farm production.

loans.name: Leorida

texts.en:
Leorida is 35 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising a pig in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Leorida has been this business for three years now and has borrowed from NWTF seven times in the past to sustain it. She would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ilsa

texts.es:
Ilsa es de la ciudad de Villarrica, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, comenta que proviene de una familia humilde y quiere poder ser alguien en la vida, es por ello que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y con ello poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Ilsa is from the city of Villarrica. She is studying accounting. She says she comes from a humble family and wants to be able to be someone in life. It is for this reason that she strives to be able to be someone in life. 

She is putting forth her best effort to be able to accomplish her goals and desires. She requests this loan to be able to pay her university tuition. With the loan she will be able to continue fighting for her goals.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 46-year-old widowed mother of three children who started providing cleaning services after her beloved husband passed away five years ago, leaving her alone responsible for taking care of their precious family.

Unfortunately, Fatima didn't attend school, which makes cleaning services the only job she can do. She proved that she can handle being the caring mother and the hard working father for the sake of the family's priorities. But sometimes she finds herself not capable of providing for all of her children's needs.

Thus, for this reason today, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her daughters' increasing school tuition fees, which were unexpected.

Fatima is determined to educate her children so that they won't face the same life she experienced.

loans.use: to pay for her daughters' increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a chair and a steam machine for his barber shop

loans.name: Maria Nieva

texts.en:
Maria Nieva is the mother of four children. She wants to give a good life to her children. At the age of 50, she owns and manages a "buy & sell" business dealing in ready-to-wear products, to help her husband make a living.

She decided to take a loan again to buy additional ready-to-wear products to sell and also to increase their family income.

Maria Nieva plans to expand her business for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear products to sell.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne, 26 years old, supports 3 family members. She has been selling vegetables and other ingredients for the last 4 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

Carolyne has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stocks of tomatoes and other vegetables to sell in the market and earn her income. Carolyne plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of tomatoes and other vegetables to sell in the market and earn her income.

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en: Ma Lina is the supportive wife of her husband in cultivating their small parcel of coconut land.  She plans to maximize the area in order to increase her income.  She became a member of Paglaum last January 2013, to avail herself of several loans with a good credit standing in terms of paying her obligations.  Now Ma. Lina has availed herself again with a loan for 10,000PHP to pay labor for land cultivation and to plant peanuts under the coconut area.  She hopes that she can harvest peanuts so that she can budget for savings in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to pay labor for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stocks of second hand shoes to satisfy his clients` demand.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a responsible mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 3 years. Balqees' husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, Balqees' husband is unable to do the necessary maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Balqees has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Balqees' husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Balqees also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Balqees is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase caps, gloves and goggles for a new business for her son.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas hasta muy noche, el se esta esforzando por poder crecer y salir adelante. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda ya que pudo surtir su negocio.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder surtir de nuevo su préstamo con bebidas, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Elias is a very hardworking person. He has a well stocked grocery store, where he works every day from very early in the morning to very late at night. He is working hard to be able to grow and move forward. He comments that his previous loan was very helpful because he was able to stock up his business with beverages, baked goods, vegetables, fruits and other items. He is grateful for the given opportunity to keep on growing with his sales as he has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked products, vegetables, fruits and other items to stock up his store.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto has a coconut farm in Paiton, Tangub. He finds pleasure in doing her farming activities and also earning for his family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, he sought financial help to purchase a variety of fruit-bearing plants that he can grow on his farm, as well as to pay for dwarf coconut and banana seedlings.

In the future, Ernesto wishes to buy a rice land to cultivate to provide sufficiently for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit-bearing plants that he can grow on his farm, as well as to pay for dwarf coconut and banana seedlings

loans.name: Mutasem

texts.en:
Mutasem is a 21-year-old single man from Ramallah City. He lives with his family in a small humble house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. Mutasem is a student in a local university where he studies business administration. 

Mutasem took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay his university fees for this semester. This will help him complete his studies and find a suitable job in the future.

loans.use: to pay his university fees for this semester

loans.name: Widad

texts.en:
Widad is a 35-year-old married woman from a small village near Jenin city. She lives with her husband and two sons and two daughters in a simple humble house. Widad's husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Widad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar system for heating water. It will help her to provide hot water for the family, without using electricity.

Widad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 37 years old. She is married and together with her spouse is blessed with 3 children, ages twelve, ten and seven years old. 

She has had a shoe selling business for 9 years. She makes a monthly income of Kshs 30000.

She will be using the loan to purchase additional stock of new shoes in order to expand her business. She knows this will help her build her own house and to send her children to school. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and support her family members."

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of new shoes in order to expand her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, 34 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past six years, Virginia has operated a motorcycle passenger business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy wheels and spare parts for her motorcycle. In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 36 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one son and two daughters who are in school. Her husband has been running his own clothing business for 4 years. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and she manages the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this clothing. 

Therefore Iram is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn the maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
 
Iram is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra, 27 years old, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 3 children.
