Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs. Zahra provides sewing services and earns am income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

Zahra needs different types of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc for her business, but is unable to purchase these accessories due to insufficient financial means. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Zahra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase accessories such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of stationery to sell in the market and meet his clients' demands

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old, married with two children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, bread and other personal care products.

Teresita has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Teresita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, sugar, bread and other personal care products

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica, 62 years old, is married and has nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past seven years, Jessica has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from fattening pigs. Jessica has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. 

Jessica has previously borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma, 48 years old, resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 3 children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past 10 years, and he is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. 

Asma's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. However, due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy all these products. Therefore Asma has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and to earn the maximum profitable income to manage his household and business. Asma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase different kinds of commodities to increase his general store business

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Damaris started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Kemera, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud. 

Although she makes a profit through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build one. She is also seeking a loan to buy poultry birds. The Nyamira area is very populated and the demand for eggs is very high. Through the dairy unit, she will have a humble time milking and feeding her cow. 

A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from the diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions, such as rain. Damaris believes that through the loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk and egg production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit and also to satisfy the ready poultry market in Nyamira.
 
Damaris waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit and buy poultry

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en: Sanoat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is one of the active women in her village. She is married and has two children. Her husband is an agrarian; he plants agricultural products and keeps livestock. Sanoat wants to help her husband and is interested in learning from her husband how to keep livestock. She is planning to buy calves and help her family with their finances. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy calves. She hopes to be supported because her family is in need of her help.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products and meet her customers' demands and requirements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: detergent, soap, corn, beans, rice, sweets, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is the hardworking mother of three and a good wife.  She helps her husband in supporting their family to buy and retail firewood and charcoal.  She has a monthly income of PHP5,000 monthly, which is a big help in their daily needs.  Lydia become a member of Paglaum last February 2012, and availed herself of several loans, with a good credibility.  She is at the same thankful to Paglaum, because of the benefits, insurance and training in terms of business management given to members.  She availed herself of a loan which is used to buy stocks of firewood and charcoal, which she delivers in the nearest town.  She dreams that someday she will buy a second hand delivery truck.

loans.use: to buy stocks for firewood and charcaol

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 40 years old, married to Anna and blessed with five children between the ages of 17 years and 4 years old. Samson deals in auto electrical parts and has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. He is served by the VFK Kapsabet office and this is his second loan. He intends to pay school fees for his children, thereby brightening their future.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: El Progreso 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado El Progreso 2 está dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nimia quien en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró en estar en un nivel de pobreza extrema.
Nimia se dedica al reciclado de todo tipo de productos, como ser cartones, aluminio, papeles y otros, que ella misma recoge de manera ambulante. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que lo hace, ya que es una manera digna de poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra en cantidad de papeles, aluminios y otros en cantidad, de manera a poder revender  y así tener un margen de ganancia para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
En la foto hay 17 mujeres, ya que el grupo tiene 17 mujeres como integrantes, pero solo 16 de ellas piden préstamo y una de ellas solo es ahorrista.
texts.en:
The group called "El Progreso 2: is in the Woman's Committee Program. They are participating in the Poverty Stoplight survey.

One of the members is Nimia who in the last Poverty Stoplight survey showed a level of extreme poverty. Nimia works recycling all kinds of products such as carton, aluminum, paper and others that she collects herself itinerantly. She comments that her work is very demanding but she does it as it is a dignified way to be able to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy paper, aluminum and others in quantity. Doing this she can re-sell it and make a profit margin to be able to continue to help her family.

There are 17 women in the photo as the group has 17 members. But only 16 of them are requesting this loan the other one is saving money.

loans.use: to buy paper, aluminum and others in quantity to re-sell.

loans.name: Giovanne

texts.en:
Giovanne has been engaged in running a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic commodities ranging from biscuits, noodles, canned goods, toiletries and condiments.  He is a 44-year-old, married man with three children ages 21, 18 and 12 respectively. He does not have sufficient funds to finance his source of income.

He is asking for a loan to purchase additional stock for the store. This stock will help attract more buyers to shop. Thus, slowly his income will augment and he will be able to pay his obligation. He will now continue to finance the schooling of his children and provide them with better shelter to live. Giovanne dreams to expand his business to make it productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for the store.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is 40 years old and married with five children. The family lives in Oroquieta, Philippines. Rosalie has rented a space in the fish market where she displays her fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return, enabling her to support the needs of their big family. Since she wants to generate more income, Rosalie joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. She has now applied for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor and be able to earn more money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belenda engages in fishing. She sells fish to the locals in her community. To augment her income, she also raises and sells hogs.  She has been engaged in that kind of business for 10 years. She is a 50-year-old married woman with five grown children residing in the town of Javier, Leyte. She encountered financial difficulty in the operation of both of her livelihoods. The photo shows the machine that was being used to pump the boat during fishing.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials and items needed for swine maintenance. These materials would be very helpful in making her day-to-day living easier. Thus, they will help her to earn higher income and be able to sustain the family's daily needs.

Belenda is hoping that she will become productive in handling her livelihood and also that it will become sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and items needed for swine maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: machines for his bicycle repair workshop.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a businesswoman from Oroquieta. She is 44 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Epifania is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Epifania continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the skill to engage any business activity.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old, married and supports a family of 6 members. He has been practicing dairy farming  for the last 5 years and earns KES7,000 per month. 

Charles has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for his customers to satisfy their demand. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start clothing sales.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for his customers to satisfy their demand.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 62 years old and married with nine children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Enriquita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other personal care products. 

In the future Enriquita would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 31-year-old married woman who is requesting a loan for her husband’s auto rickshaw’s body maintenance. Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years. Her husband used to drive the rickshaw at night because the passengers pay more at nighttime than in the daytime. A few weeks ago he was casually driving the rickshaw at nighttime, and due to darkness, his rickshaw collapsed with the barriers and its body got seriously damaged. Now the passengers do not like to sit under the rickshaw.

Therefore, Shumaila requested a loan for her husband so that he can maintain the rickshaw body and can drive it smoothly again. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband. Shumaila thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: a loan helps Shumaila's husband to maintain the rickshaw's body.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 60 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Meriam runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Meriam would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a 29-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and she has to face a lot of problems to feed all of them in a day and to fulfill all the household expenses. Ayesha's husband is the sole earner who has to provide for all the household expenses through a single source of income, a computer accessories shop. He sells computer accessories such as mice, keyboards, monitors, sound cards, graphics cards, pen drives, etc. It is a challenge for him to sell his products in the market where is a lot of competition.

With the gradual increase in household expenses, Ayesha's husband wants to grow his income, as well. Therefore, Ayesha has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could  buy more computer accessories for his shop. Ayesha hopes that this loan will prove a productive one for business and for her family also. Ayesha is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase computer accessories for reselling.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima, 50 years old, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and four daughters. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for 8 years, and he is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Salima's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for resale but, due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do so. Therefore Salima is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. Salima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to purchase clothes in bulk to increase his business

loans.name: Khatija

texts.en:
Khatija is 52 years old.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 6 children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family.  Khatija is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute, with her husband, to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods: e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purposes. But due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Khatija is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a hard-working wife and mother of two kids. She always wants the best for her family, especially her children. Her husband is a fisherman, but his income is not enough to meet the family's needs. Elizabeth sells bananas to help her husband. She applied for a loan from Paglaum to buy additional stock of bananas to retail. She hopes and prays that her business will supply her nearest town.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of banana to sell

location.town: Calamba-Tamban Punta Miray Baliangao Misamis Occid

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino, a farmer, is 58 years old and is very responsible with his household obligations, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and four children. He is a farmer who plants corn, vegetables, beans and grows root crops as well.

Rufino wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: sweet bread, coffee, cereals, dairy products, candy, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, lime and propane.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is single man, aged 22. He takes care of his three nephews, who attend different schools. The boys live with him because they lost their parents, and Ronald lives in a town with the family. He runs a boutique business where he sells second-hand clothes. He also is an agriculturalist, growing beans, maize and matooke. He started his business in 2011.

Ronald works 10 hours a day,  6 days a week. He started the business to improve his welfare, earn school fees for his nephews and get food for the family. He has requested a loan to add stock of clothes in the business. His main clients are residents and passersby.

Ronald's hope for the future is to shop from outside nations like China and Turkey. He also hopes to build his own home. The challenge he faces is many clients taking long to settle their debts. He describes himself as a hard-working man who appreciates the fact that Kiva lenders want to partner with young entrepreneurs like him by giving them access to loans to develop their businesses.

loans.use: To add to his stock clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production. She hopes this will enable her to meet the high demand for milk to supply her customers.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a 26 years old, married and she supports eight family members. 

She has been operating her general retail for the last 10 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 17,000. 

Rael has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to use to purchase more stock to sell to her clients in the market and meet their demands. 

She plans to use the profit to repay the loan and educate her children. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to her clients in the market and meet their demands.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old. She is married with three children aged between 1 and 18 years. She owns a cafeteria and she has been doing this business for the past 4 years. Her husband is a local constructor. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more milk and bread for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and make savings.

loans.use: To buy more milk and bread for sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber and plywood for making more furniture to sell to his clients and meet his family's needs.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 47 years old, married and supports 5 family members. She has been operating a general store for the last 20 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Hellen has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to use to purchase more stock to meet the demands of her customers. 

She hopes to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and be financially stable.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her retail store to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of oil and sugar to sell to meet the demands of her clients.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Rosa está en su 3er. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una quiere ir mejorando su situación de vida y las de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirian quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza extrema, ella tiene un copetín en el que trabaja todos los días para poder tener los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas, yogur, comestibles varios y otros, y así poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y así poder seguir trabajando y luchando para dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en: The group called Santa Rosa is in its third cycle of the women's committee program. They are doing a poll on poverty elimination, where each of them wants to improve her life situation and that of her loved ones. One of the members is Mirian, who in her poll showed a level of extreme poverty. She has a small restaurant where she works every day to be able to earn the income to support her family and her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to buy beverages, yogurt, various food items, and other things, and be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing so far; and in this way keep on working and struggling to give her family what they need.

loans.use: to buy beverages, yogurt, various food items, and other things.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a 53-year-old, from Oroquieta and married. She joined PMPC, in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. Recently, she accessed her third loan in the amount of PHP 11,000 for additional working capital to buy a variety of grocery items for her existing business, which sells a variety of food and non-food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Angel Lee

texts.en: Angel Lee earns a living through her direct-selling business of cosmetics, food supplements and clothing. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, Angel Lee applied for a loan to purchase additional sticks and marine plywood for her house. She is on her way to building her own house. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sticks and marine plywood for her house

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita makes a living through her retail business, buying and selling native products. She earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up a membership with PMPC to gain access of capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. 

Now, she has availed a loan to purchase more native products to sell. Warlita hopes to sustain her business and dreams to open a show room for her native products business.

loans.use: to purchase more native products to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 46 years old, married and has six children. She wants to help her husband with their living and also increase their family income for their children's daily needs. That's why she is in the food vending business. She decided to borrow another loan to purchase additional ingredients to make siopao and be able to sell more siopao in the community.

In the future, Margie wants to have her own pumpboat for her husband for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients to make siopao.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fresh succulent sugarcane

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired supporting her family. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds for her growing hogs. Aside from her project of adding heads of pigs, she thought of working on swine production for her business expansion. Someday she hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds for her growing hogs

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 30-year-old poor lady. She and her family are passing their lives in very miserable conditions. Because her husband does not earn a sufficient income and his profession is not able to generate a high turnover. Most of the time his rickshaw remains out of order, although he earns money then he has to spend a part of it on maintenance. 

Therefore, Nazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, so that her husband can fully maintain his rickshaw and can abstain from daily maintenance expenditures. Nazia hopes that the auto rickshaw will be in order for a long time. 

Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: 's husband with the maintenance of his rickshaw.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is 28 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Uzma's husband provides a service changing seat covers of vehicles. He purchases ready-made seat covers and stitches as well. His shop is situated in the vehicle’s workshop market. He has to pick up customers one by one and convince them to change the seat covers of their vehicle. He does not take much of his customers' time and quickly changes the seat covers. Before, he was providing services only for motorbike seats, but now he wants to provide services for various cars as well. For this purpose he wants to buy various colors and types of rexine (imitation leather) so that he can show his arts for sewing car’s seats also.

Therefore, Uzma requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy various types of rexine for sewing seat covers. Uzma thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase rexine for for her husband's vehicle seat cover business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 34-year-old, married mother of four children. She decided five years ago to open her own grocery store to support her husband, who works as a farmer, to increase their family's income and develop their living. Her business is going on just fine, but she needs external financial support to expand and develop her business properly.

Amal has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles with a good standing pay back history. All of her previously acquired loans helped her a lot in increasing her business capital. Today, and for the same reason, Amal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her foodstuff capital with special offers that will attract customers' attention and increase her income. She is working hard to expand her work place and attract more customers.

loans.use: to increase her foodstuff capital with special offers that will attract customers' attention and increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hotel chairs and tables for quality standards.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 47 years old and married with four children. She has had a sari-sari store business for 10 years. Because of the demand of her customers in their city, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Norte, she requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn engages in raising and selling hogs.  She is a 23-year-old married woman with a one-year old son. 

She has been engaged in the hog raising business for two years now. Her husband operates a motorcycle transport services, and his income will help defray the family's daily needs. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte.

She is asking for a loan  to buy piglets and feeds. This will help improve the quality of hogs Jocelyn is about to raise. Thus, it creates her  income to improve. With these, slowly she could now expand the number of hogs she want to and able to handle her finances. She could now afford to buy nutritious meals to the whole family.

Jocelyn is very thankful for the loan she is availing. She is determined to manage her livelihood properly for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Teresita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Kisakye Group Kirinya Bweyogerere

texts.en:
Brenda is a new client in UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), having applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 through the group.  She is a married woman and has children.

She is a business woman selling charcoal. In a bid to increase her working capital and expand the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000. This will help her to buy more sacks of charcoal that she will sell in retail to maximise profit. 

However she is faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital, which soon she will be able to overcome with continual financial support from UGAFODE.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders have offered to her and fellow group members since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal for trade

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 46-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband has been running a crockery shop for the past eight years. Her husband is solely responsible to provide for the needs of his entire family and manage the household.

Shahida's husband wants to purchase different types of crockery such as jugs, glasses, dinner sets, etc. to fulfill the demands of his customers. Due to financial constraints her husband is not in the position to buy these items for reselling purposes. Shahida has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these things to fulfill his business needs. This will also help him to increase his daily sales and earn more income to manage the business and the family's needs.

Shahida is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crockery items for her husband to sell in his business

loans.name: Josfeen

texts.en:
Josfeen is a 45 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. Her husband owns a printing shop and is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the needs of all the family members. 

Josfeen has been running her own beauty saloon for the past six years and she also contributes her income, with her husband, to manage the household. 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics: i.e creams, hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty saloon, but due to financial constraints, she is not capable to buy these items for her business purposes. 

Therefore Josfeen has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business, so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also be helpful for her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Josfeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old, married to Patrick and she supports 6 family members. 

She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last 20 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES10,000.

Agnes has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to use to buy materials for shade construction over her activities. 

She plans to use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and be financially stable. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy materials for shade construction over her activities.

loans.name: Soro

texts.en:
Soro is a hardworking woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1962. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is married and has children. 

Sora is an active, careful and responsible agrarian. She, along with her husband, is planting wheat, cereal and potatoes in their yard. Each season they grow their harvest to sell in the market. Also they keep livestock and feed them for further trading. The money that she earns from their harvest and business is used for every day needs. She asked a loan from the Kiva lenders to spend on family needs (clothes and food). 

They hope next year to work hard and get a good harvest from their agriculture and livestock. She hopes to be supported in her difficult times.

loans.use: to spend on family needs (clothes and food)

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 53 years old and she supports eight family members. 

She has been selling maize grains in the market for the last 20 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 11,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which she plans to purchase more stock of maize grains for sale in the market to meet the demands of her customers.
 
She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children to higher level of education. Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize grains for sale in the market

loans.name: Vema

texts.en: Vema is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She owns and manages a sari-sari store business to earn income. To increase her family income, she decided to borrow a loan again to buy additional grocery items for the store to sell, to increase her store inventory and her sales that will generate more income. Vema’s plan for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items for the store to sell.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 53 years old and married with five children. With two children who are still in school, Rufina works very hard to provide for them.

Rufina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Rufina has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Janera

texts.en:
Janera is 50 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, chips, spices, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc to sell in her general store.

Janera has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending and raising livestock.

Janera aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, chips, spices, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters. 

Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for ten years. Her husband is alone responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore Shamim is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his clothing business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 26 years old and a born hard-worker. She is dedicated and responsible, and knows how to use her skills as a farmer. Although a humble woman, she is creative and knows how to make the most of opportunities. She lives in Ekerenyo, a remote village in Nyamira area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with four adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Nyamira area is very populated, so demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and extend her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production and meet the demands of her customers in milk supply.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is 21 years old, and lives with his wife, in Gaza. He has a store for the sale and repair of refrigerators. He is one of the affected people from the last war in Gaza. His house was partially destroyed, and he would like to repair it. For this reason, he has requested a loan to rebuild the kitchen, install pipelines, and to buy glass and planks for renovating his home.

Iyad is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life again with his family, and to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to rebuild the kitchen, install pipelines, and to buy glass and planks for renovating his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate (repair) a business house, which is for selling tea and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Saiideh

texts.en:
Saiideh is a 45-year-old single woman, who has been working in sewing, beadwork and embroidery for 11 years. She runs her business from home, because she lives alone and can provide her customers with suitable privacy.

Today Saiideh is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise with lingerie and invest in an empty room to store her products, and she wants to buy a new tailoring machine, which will help her satisfy her customers' special needs. She hopes to improve her business, as much as she can to improve her living.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with lingerie, invest in an empty room to store her products, and to buy a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Codwin

texts.es:
El señor Codwin de 61 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su  hijo, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la actividad de su Taller de Mecánica  Automotriz  y También de Motocicletas, el hace reparaciones de todo tipo en motos y carro y al mismo tiempo les da mantenimiento, sus clientes son todas las personas que cuentan con su carro o su motocicleta en la zona, y aprovechando que él es el único mecánico de la zona. El radica en el municipio de san José Choluteca al sur de Honduras, el es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Don Codwin está solicitando el préstamo para surtir su Taller con repuestos como aceite, bujías, bandas, focos, fricciones, filtros, stickers, juegos de tracción, cilindros, pistones, cadenas, cables y bobinas además de accesorios de moto quiere aprovechar que nadie vende repuestos en la zona, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA.
Don Codwin su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
San Lorenzo valle, Honduras - ABRIL  2015.
texts.en:
Señor Codwin, who is 61 years old, lives in his own house along with his son. For 10 years he has been working in his workshop for automotive and also motorcycle mechanics. He does repairs of all types on motorcycles and cars, and at the same time he maintains them. His customers are everyone in the zone who has a car or motorcycle, and he makes use of the fact that he is the only mechanic in the zone. He is settled in the town of San José Choluteca in the south of Honduras. He is an entrepreneurial man with the desire to get ahead, and he strives every day to improve his quality of life.

Don Codwin is applying for the loan to stock his workshop with spare parts such as oil, spark plugs, belts, headlights, brake linings, filters, permit stickers, traction sets, cylinders, pistons, chains, cables, and coils, as well as motorcycle accessories. He wants to take advantage of the fact that no one in the zone sells spare parts. He is a new client with the desire to work with Prisma and with Kiva.

Don Codwin's dream is to make his business grow to improve his quality of life.

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras - April  2015.

loans.use: to buy oil, spark plugs, belts, headlights, brake linings, filters, permit stickers, traction sets, cylinders, pistons, chains, cables, and coils, in addition to accessories for his workshop

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronica is 52 years old. She is married with 3 children. She has had a Green grocery business for 23 years. 

She is applying for her loan to purchase tomatoes, potatoes and green maize for sale and hopes this will help her pay school fees and feed her family.

This is her fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her business to wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes and green maize for sale

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina engages in selling nipa shingles (feather-leaved palm, use as roofing for native houses). She is a 37 year old woman with three children residing in the town of Javier, Leyte. Her oldest child is 19 and the youngest is 13. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 5 years now. She is in need of capital to continue operation of her source of income.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more supplies for nipa. In this way, she could now purchase more nipa shingles and cater to the needs of her respective customers. Thus, it would really help augment her earnings and help her to handle her finances. She could now be able to expand her business for improvement and growth.

Marcelina hopes that she would be able to manage her current business for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for nipa

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with four children. She is 49 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nenita has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more items like toys, school supplies and other personal care products.

Nenita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like toys, school supplies and other personal care products.

loans.name: Nenica

texts.en:
Nenica is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nenica is 49 years old and has thee children who are in school.

Nenica has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nenica has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Nenica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 45 years old and has three children. Ellen is married and has one child in school.

Ellen is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ellen has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ellen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Hello Lenders!  Meet Philister a marvelous, good hearted young woman who makes her living through practicing mixed farming. She is ambitious and full of hope for the future. She makes a living doing mixed farming in Lessos village, located in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and poultry for commercial milk and eggs respectively. 

Besides mixed farming, Philister is also very concerned about the health of the environment. She spends most of her time working on her farm. Philister is seeking a KES 10,000 loan to purchase farm implements. These tools will make the work on her farm move much faster and easier. Tending to her farm involves a lot of digging, uprooting, planting and packaging. There are various tools in the market that are handy for a woman in her line of work. The equipment does not come cheap, however. The increase in income from this investment will go to her family's welfare and her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Marcia works very hard to provide for them.

Marcia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Marcia has been in this business for 2 years now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Marcia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean, 52, living in Soni kom district of Siem Reap province, is a married mother of four children, and two of them are in school. She tries to overcome her family’s hardship through growing rice, feeding pigs and working for other farms for a fee. She has been involved in these businesses for twenty years. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is now applying for this loan in order to pay for her children’s school fee and buy some study tools. She hopes that her children will complete their studying from university and have a good job.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fees and buy some study tools

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Soni kom District

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a father of four who runs a small business in Nairobi. He hopes to use the business income and Fresh Life Toilet to clear the loan. He recently learned about Fresh Life Toilet through a friend and thought it would be wise to try the franchise. He identified the opportunity after speaking to one of the operators who owns a number of Fresh life toilets, and was impressed by the income the operator makes in a single day.

He is seeking a loan to enable him pay for one toilet. The toilet would enable the community to enjoy a hygienic neighborhood, which is currently lacking. He hopes that the new venture will generate enough income to help him pay the loan, and subsequently be able to pay school fees for his four kids. He is also optimistic to add more Fresh Life Toilets in the same place, as well as within the entire neighborhood.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of tomatoes and assorted vegetables

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 44-year-old married mother of three children. Four years ago her husband left his cars spare parts shop and traveled outside Lebanon seeking a better job with better salary.  So she decided to manage her husband's shop and in parallel, she started a business of clearing transactions in an attempt to satisfy her children's needs. She faced difficulties at the beginning, but she soon gained managerial skills.
 
Aida is an ambitious and sacrificing mother, who became her children's father and mother at the same time. Although her husband returned to Lebanon, she is still working hard and trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions.  Thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees.

Aida hopes to expand her business more and she is trying to open a special car's spare parts shop for her husband to manage.  She hopes to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plots for farming

loans.name: Hawraa

texts.en:
Hawraa is a 25-year-old married mother of two children, who started her own clothes selling business two years ago, which she runs from her house to support her husband in covering their family's increasing needs. Hawraa's business is going on just fine, especially because currently she has a good number of loyal customers who support her and trust her.

Thus, to improve her family's living, Hawraa is taking the full responsibility of supporting and developing her husband's business. He runs an entertaining billiard shop through an acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. She wants to buy an espresso machine to support her husband in developing his business and increasing their family's income. She hopes that she can stay capable of developing her family's living and providing most of their needs.

loans.use: to buy an espresso machine to support her husband in developing his business and increasing their family's income.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 49 years old and married with three children. Wilfreda works very hard to provide for them.

Wilfreda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries.

Wilfreda has been in this business for 10 years now. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Wilfreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 51 years old now.

Vicenta is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Vicenta has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise  her livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of timber for making more sofa sets to sell to meet the demands of his clients.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Nancy is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming vegetable business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 58 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and six children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 15 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Robina's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of clothes, laces, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business purpose. 

Therefore Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband with these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Robina is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en:
Ephraim is a married man, aged 43 years with six children, who are 18, 16,14,12,10 and 8 years respectively. He lives in a rural area with his family. All of his children are still attending schools. He deals in small-scale agriculture, specifically growing bananas and he supplements his family income with a salary, which he earns from teaching. He works four days a week and each day he works for 10 hours.

He started his business in 2004 due to experience he had in agriculture and to earn a living. He has acquired this loan facility in order to pay school fees for his son who is in technical college. His clients are traders from the capital city, and his dream is to educate all his children to the higher levels of education. He says he still faces the challenges of price fluctuations in agriculture goods, weather changes, and lack of enough capital to use modern methods of agriculture, which can lead to high volume of harvests.

He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man. He asks God to bless the works of Ugafode and Kiva lenders, saying they will enable his son to complete college courtesy of the UGAFODE school fees loan.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his son in college.

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.en:
Anvarjon is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985. He is living in a rural area with his family and is married with three children. He has nine years experience doing business in agriculture. He has land where he plants vegetables and agricultural products. He works hard to have a good harvest and feed his family. 

After marriage, he inherited a house from his father. The house is in need of renovation. This year the agricultural harvest was not good because of the season. He needed to fly to Russia and earn money to feed his family. Now, he come back and needs to renovate their house to live in. 

He asks a loan from Kiva lenders to buy construction supplies to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate his  house

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 54 years old, married to Alice, and he supports seven family members. He has been in the electronics repair appliances business for the last 15 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 14,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase more repair tools and appliances to make his work efficient and faster in the market, hence attracting more customers and earning more income. 

He plans to use the earned profit to repay the loan, expand his business, and recruit more staff. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more repair tools and appliances to make his work efficient and faster in the market

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Necitas is 59 years old and has two children who are in school.

Necitas has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Necitas has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Necitas would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 58 years old and has three children. Celestina is married woman.

Celestina is in the agricultural business farming vegetable in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Celestina has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Celestina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Akhtar Bibi

texts.en:
Akhtar Bibi is a simple housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 18 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He needs to make maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of it is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Akhtar Bibi has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Akhtar Bibi also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income, to meet her family's needs in the future. She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Sokhom, 33, is a father of a child, living in Phnom Penh city. He is a house renovator and to earn more income he also rents his house to others for a fee.  He has been involved in this business for eight years. Due to lack of education and having not enough ability, he decided to apply for a loan to pay for school fees. He hopes that he can complete his studying and get a better job in the future.

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Santacruz Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santacruz está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty.  Las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Señora Edita,  es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, con este trabajo desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y  que por medio de las reuniones de capacitaciones quiere ir mejorando con su grupo.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de más  animales para la cría y poder vender conforme pase el tiempo, para que así genere su propio ingreso y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group called Santacruz is in its fourth loan cycle of the women's communal bank program. It is located in the city of Curuguaty.  The members of this group want to strive to get ahead little by little and give the area where they live a better environment.

Edita is one of the members. She raises animals and with this work wishes to improve her family's quality of life. Through the training workshops they want to improve their group little by little.

She is requesting this loan to buy more animals to raise and sell as time goes on, so that in this way she can generate her own income and give her family what they need in order to have a life without hardships.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is engaged in a food vending business. She sells home-made barbecue and snack foods like toron (consists of a plantain wrapped like a spring roll and then deep fried; filling is the saba variety of banana). This is her main source of income. She is 38-year-old married woman with five dependents. She lives in Javier, Leyte.

She is asking for a loan to buy food utensils like  trays and more supplies for food vending. These ingredients will be used in preparing barbecue and snack foods to sell. With the additional capital, Lita would now start to expand her food vending business and able to prepare her children healthy meals. 

Lita is eager to handle her business properly for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy food utensils like  trays and more supplies for food vending

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of baking flour for making more chapati and mandazi to sell to his clients and meet their demands.

loans.name: Tol's Group

texts.en: Tol’s group lives in a rural village in Pursat province in Cambodia. Tol makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water to sell to increase her income

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 20 years old and she supports 2 family members. She has been a small scale farmer for the last 6 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES10,000. 

Getrude has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to use to purchase certified seeds for farming. 

Her plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds for farming.

loans.name: Rosa Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Poty está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 7 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes variados, ellas es una mujer muy trabajadora y quiere poder seguir creciendo y mejorando para poder ayudar a su familia y a las personas que ella quiere. Liz está poniendo  todo su empeño para poder crecer y mejorar su vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar perfumes variados y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Ella quiere seguir creciendo y por ello está luchando cada día.
texts.en:
The group calleed Rosa Poty is participating in the poverty elimination survey, where 7 members are below the poverty line, that is to say in extreme poverty.

Liz is one of the members, and she sells a variety of perfumes. She is a very hard-working woman and wants to be able to continue growing and improving so that she can help her family and the people she loves. 

Liz is putting all her effort into growing, and improving her life. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a variety of perfumes and in this way be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She wants to continue growing and for this reason is striving each day.

loans.use: To buy a variety of perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cosmetics for sale to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a car wash which will meet the demands of clients who want to wash their motorcycles and vehicles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, cements, sand, iron beams, metal plates and nails to install the room in her home.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo works hard to support her family. Amparo is married and has a manicure and pedicure services business in the Philippines.

Amparo requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like nail polish, nail clippers and other materials for her business.

Amparo has been in this business for 37 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials like nail polish, nail clippers and other materials for her business

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 37 years old and married with eight children. With five children are still in school, Mirasol works very hard to provide for them.

Mirasol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, sugar, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Mirasol has been in this business for 8 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purcahse more items of groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, sugar, cooking oil and other personal care products

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 42 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two sons, who are in school. Her husband has been running his own business of garments and cloth selling for 12 years and he only is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

Her husband needs to purchase different types of garments and cloth in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these items. Therefore Noreen is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these garments and cloth in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
 
Noreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's garments and cloth business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 37 years old and she supports 5 family members. She has been selling cereals in the market for the last 10 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 13,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to use to purchase more stocks of cereals for sale in the market and gain profit for sustaining her family needs.  She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of cereals for sale in the market and gain profit for sustaining her family needs.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Divinas está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres. Es de la ciudad de Caacupé, son 17 mujeres todas muy unidas y luchadoras que quieren dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y que vayan mejorando por medio de las capacitaciones  que va recibiendo por medio del programa de comité de mujeres.
Laura es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a las confecciones, comenta que tiene un taller de confecciones en su casa, y por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo lucha para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella quiere crecer e ir mejorando, es por ello que pone todo su entusiasmo y esmero para poder seguir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos,  gomas, botones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
The group 'Las Divinas' is currently going through their 9th loan cycle in the women's committe program. They are located in the city of Caacupé, and the group is composed of 17 very closed and hard-working women who want to provide their families with a better quality of life, through the training they receive thanks to the women's committe program.
Laura is one of their members. She is a dressmaker and she runs a trailor shop out of her home. Thanks to her hard work she is dedicted to provide her loved ones with a decent living without struggle. She wants to grow and improve, so she puts everything she's got into getting better every day.
She is asking for this loan to invest in fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other items to continue working in her dressmaking business. She is thankful for this opportunity she is being given to continue improving.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons and other items to use in dressmaking

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 52 year old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is the mother of two sons and two daughters. 

Her husband has been doing a scrap recycling business.  He needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle it but due to some financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy the scrap in bulk, therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan amount will enable her husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk, so that he can easily adopt the recycling procedure and earn a profitable income derived from his business.

Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Adaku

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Adarku, who is single and has five children ages 24,21,18,16 and 15. In 1999, Adarku decided to to sell kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish. She began her business because she wants to take care of her children's education to university level, which requires a lot of work. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns a very good profit every month from this business, which she has been using to take care of her children. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,500 GHS. Adarku requires the loan in order to buy more corn and fish to prepare kenkey and fish so that she can sell to customers. In the future, Adarku plans to educate her children to university level and to build a house. She is very hard working. 

She thanks Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy more corn and fish to prepare kenkey and fish so that she can sell to customers.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Soledad is 51 years old and has one child is still in school.

Soledad has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Soledad requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Soledad has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mukhtiar

texts.en:
Mukhtiar is 49 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband has been running a general store for the past seven years, and he is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Mukhtiar's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities like rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business. However, due to financial constraints her husband is not in a suitable position to buy all of the above products to resell. Therefore, Mukhtiar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities, and also help him earn a profitable income to manage his household and business. Mukhtiar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of commodities like rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for her husband's business.

loans.name: Roby Group

texts.en:
Nadia is the featured representative of Roby group. She and the other group members are best friends and got together to help each other improve their livelihoods. They are acquiring a loan from Kiva’s Field Partner, Al Majmoua.

Nadia is a 50-year-old widowed mother of one, and she is responsible for supporting an additional family member. She has always been able to provide for her child after the death of her husband through her work as a beautician. Today, Nadia is acquiring a loan from Kiva in order to renovate her house by painting the walls. 

Nadia is the first lady on the right of the photo. Hiba is the second member of the group and is sitting in the middle, while Rina is on the left.

loans.use: to renovate her house by painting the walls.

loans.name: Maria Adriana

texts.es: María tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 33 años de edad. María es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración de arroz con leche lo que le permite apoyar la economía de su hogar. Ella desea encementar el piso y colocar ventanas y puertas en su vivienda, pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios y ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ventanas y puertas para mejorar el cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en: María is 58 years old. She lives in a house she owns with her husband and her 33-year-old son. María is very resourceful. She sells rice pudding which allows her to financially support her household. She would like to pour cement on the floor and install windows and doors in the home, but she doesn't have enough resources to do so. For this reason, she decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, windows and doors to improve a room in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, windows and doors to improve a room in her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a means of transport to ease her work in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase metal for making steel windows and doors, which he will sell to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Momanyi

texts.en:
Momanyi is a 28-year-old man, who is married to Lilian and supports 5 family members.

He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the past year and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase a cow for milk production. He will then use the income earned from it for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle, in order to offer better transportation services to his customers.

His plans to use the profits to repay the loan and buy more motorcycles for transportation services. His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production and use the income earned for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle, in order to offer better transportation services to his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothing to sell to her customers in order to earn profits with which to educate her children.

loans.name: Rusina

texts.en:
Rusina is 41 years old, married and supports 6 family members. She has been operating her general store for the last 20 years, and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Rusina has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to buy stock for her store in order to generate more income. 

Her hope is to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to make her financially stable.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business in order to gain more income

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man aged 28 years with two children. He is still young and lives in a rural setting with his family. He deals in agricultural produce trading i.e. selling of dry coffee, beans, maize, cassava and peas. He supplements his family income with the sale of animals. He works seven days a week and each day he works for 12 hours.

He started his business in 2001 with the aim of getting money to increase the family income. He has acquired this loan facility in order to buy additional stock, since the coffee harvest has started. His clients are traders from the capital city and his dream is to enlarge his business, but his biggest challenge is limited capital.
