He describes himself as a hard working man.

loans.use: To buy stock of coffee to boost his coffee trade

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en:
Gulom is a strong man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1964. He lives in a rural area where he does business. He is married and has three children.

Gulom is capable, good mannered and an honest person. He is well known among people in his village. Because of a lack of opportunity to find a job, his sons went to Russia to earn some money and help their father financially. 

Gulom was used to hard conditions of living in a rural area, and did his best to have a good agricultural business. There is no other business that could earn him a profit. Recently, he keeps livestock, gardens and plants agricultural products. He planned to do his business better this year, but he does not have money to accomplish his plans. In spite of this, he planted cereal on his land and now needs to care for them in order to gain a good harvest. 

Gulom is using IMON’s service during this year.  He asks for a loan to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and corns for his plantings. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, natural chemicals and corns for his plantings.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es:
En total son 23 mujeres inspiradas que se esfuerzan día a día para solventar los gastos del hogar y por sobre todo aumentar sus ingresos. Forman parte del comité con el fundamento de ayudarse y más bien consideran una oportunidad de suma importancia para ellas para trabajar y obtener sus propios ingresos y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Veronica es una de las que integra este grupo, ella tiene una tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad, tiene una despensa bien surtida con muchos productos, y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela y que va mejorando cada día para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Veronica pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, bebidas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
These are 23 women inspired and working hard to cover their household expenses on a daily basis and, especially, to increase their income. They are part of this committee to help one another and they see it as an extremely important opportunity to work and have an income to help their families.
Veronica is one of their members. She owns a minimarket and sells basic needs items. She has a good customer base and she is making improvements every day to be able to provide her famility with the things she wasn't able to have.
Veronica is asking for this loan to invest in vegetables, fruits, beverages, bakery items and others, to continue selling at a steady pace. She is thankful for this opportunity to continue improving and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, beverages, bakery items and others to sell at a minimarket.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 52-year-old divorced mother of one child. She has worked hard for eight years selling accessories from her house in order to provide her child with the best education for a brighter future.

Sahar is well-known in her region, thanks to the good reputation she has and her special talents in her domain, as well as her hard work to provide her child with the daily necessities, especially after divorce.

Sahar's income is barely enough to cover her little family's living needs, thus her medical needs aren't taken into consideration. Through an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, Sahar will pay for necessary urgent dental treatment.

She hopes that in the future she can open her own accessory sales shop and attract more customers.

loans.use: To pay for necessary urgent dental treatment

loans.name: Wandemi Small Scale Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The man raising his hand holding a passbook is James. He is 65 years old, married, and a father of two. James joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2011 to benefit from the enterprise development and financial management training.

He is a mixed farmer practicing both dairy and vegetable farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds for his dairy cows so as to increase milk production. This will enable him earn more income and hence meet his family's needs (e.g. food and clothing) with ease.

James is happy with Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed to increase milk production and hence earn more income to meet his family's needs with ease.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa  está en su ciclo número 4to. Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Pelagia, quien se dedica a la venta de mandiocas, es una mujer muy trabajadora que con su humilde trabajo trata de ganarse el pan de cada día, para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Ella quiere ir mejorando por medio de las capacitaciones y es por eso que pone su mejor esfuerzo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar mandioca en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa is in it's 4th loan cycle. They are participating in the women's committee program and are part of the eradication of poverty survey. 10 of their members are below the poverty line, that is, extreme proverty.
One of the members, Pelagia, sells cassava or mandioca. She is hard working and with her humble trade she tries to make ends meet every day to be able to help her loved ones. She wants to improve herself through these training programs, so she puts great effort into them.
She is asking for this loan to buy mandioca wholesale, to she can continue reselling this product. She is thankful for this opportunity to continue to grow and support her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy cassava (mandioca) wholesale for retail.

loans.name: Faithfulness Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Faithfulness, and they are on their sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana.

The businesses run by the members include cooking beans, gari (cassava flour), and ripe plantains, and selling curtains.

The loan that they will receive will benefit their micro businesses. This is Vivian's sixth year with ID-Ghana. She joined by invitation from her sister, who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling cooked beans, gari (cassava flour), and ripe plantains. She began this business on her own about 12 years ago.

The loan that Vivian has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase cooked beans, gari (cassava flour), and ripe plantains, which she will sell to customers. She will purchase the products from the market and later sell them at her residence.

This job allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married with four dependent children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are responsible, which has helped them very much.

loans.use: To purchase cook beans, gari (cassava flour), and ripe plantains, which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Experito

texts.en:
Experito is a married man who operates a produce store, mainly buying and selling maize, rice and beans. He complements his business with farming, from which he obtains additional income.

Due to the fact that he is the sole provider for his family, Experito engaged in business with a vision of providing his children with education up to the university level. He complains of unpredictable weather changes affecting his returns. Experito intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Siove

texts.en:
Siove runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities ranging from biscuits, noodles, coffee, cooking oil, shampoo, soft drinks and toiletries. She is a 33-year-old married woman with two children of the ages eight and six. She hails from Mcarthur, Leyte.

Siove requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP  to buy additional stocks for the store, like canned goods, seasonings and toiletries. These stocks will help improve the content of her store and enable her to attract more buyers to shop. She will be able to sell more goods and start to handle her obligations. 

With the capital she borrows, Siove would like to manage it properly, and to have a productive and sustainable business in the future to come.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store.

loans.name: Islomjon

texts.en:
Islomjon is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. He lives in a rural area, and is married with three children. He is an active, honest, good mannered and kind person. 

Islomjon and his wife are in the agriculture business, planting potato and cereal. Besides this activity, he keeps livestock and sells them in a domestic animal market. From each sold livestock, he gains 500 TJS and uses it for his family's needs. Islomjon keeps his livestock on nearby mountains and hills for five months where he feeds them. 

Islomjon is planning to buy more livestock and have a bigger farm. He asks for a loan for this from Kiva lenders to continue his business. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 26 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She joined Hand in Hand East Africa so as to benefit from the training offered, especially that on savings mobilization and enterprise development.

She is a farmer growing potatoes and carrots, and she also sells second-hand clothes. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more assorted clothes to add stock to her enterprise. This will enable her earn more income with which to pay school fees for her children.

Beatrice appreciates Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: To buy more assorted second-hand clothes so as to add stock to her second-hand clothes sales business for more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Mary. She is 54 years old, married and has four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2012 to benefit from the enterprise development and financial management training offered.

Mary operates a grocery shop and is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables (e.g. cabbages, carrots, mangoes and passion fruits) so as to add stock to her grocery store for increased income. This will help meet her family's basic needs, such as food, clothing and school fees.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables so as to add stock to her grocery store for increased income.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Mary. She is 57 years old, married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to gain knowledge on business management and also to borrow loans to improve her business.

Her economic activities are dairy and vegetable farming. She also farms maize, beans and potatoes. She is borrowing money to buy animal feeds and also to build a good shed for her cattle. She hopes that this will assist in improving her farming.

Mary is happy that she can get money in time and be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and to pay for construction of a cow shed that will ensure healthy animals and improved productivity.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Senhora Lídia tem 41 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 2 estudam frequentando ensino secundário e outros no ensino primário, é negociante, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado vai aplicar para comprar, maça, banana, lixas, quiwi, ameixa, para revender na sua banca.
No futuro pretende ampliar o seu negócio, e tornar se uma empresária na área comercial, pretende também iniciar com a criação de frangos.
Devido as dificuldades financeiras recorre aos empréstimo na Hluvuku, assim sendo quer liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora como forma de garantir futuros financiamentos
texts.en:
Lídia is 41 years old. She is married with 5 children, two of them in high school, and the rest in primary school. She is a business woman and she lives in a house she owns with her family.
She will use this loan to buy apples, bananas, lychees, kiwis, plums to sell in her stand.
In the future, she would like to expand her business, and become a business woman in the commercial area of town. She will also like to begin raising chicken.
Due to financial difficulties, she turns to Hluvuku's for loans, but she wants to replay this loan in time, in order to have the chance to request for future financing opportunities.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, lychees, kiwis, plums to sell in her stand.

loans.name: Kyeni Kya Mukuyuni Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Bibiana. She is a member of the Kyeni Kya Mukuyuni group and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 and has benefited from training, especially on enterprise development.

Bibiana operates a green grocer store selling fruits and vegetables. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more assorted fruits and vegetables for her store and to increase her income. She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fruits and vegetables for her green grocer store.

loans.name: Niño Salvador Del Mundo Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres NIÑO SALVADOR DEL MUNDO, está en su cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La fundación ha implementado con ellas el programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les podrá ayudar a conocer su situación de vida, y conforme a ello poder ir mejorándola y crecer para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una persona que se destaca por su entusiasmo y por sus ganas de salir adelante e ir mejorando es la Sra. Miriam quien vende prendas de todo tipo, y aunque sabe que es muy dificil hoy dia la competencia, de igual manera se esfuerza para poder crecer y tener los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Miriam pide este prestamo ya que con ello podrá seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando y esforzandose por mejorar. Ella quiere comprar prendas variadas, como ser jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones, camperas, blusas, y otros.
texts.en:
The committee of women Niño Salvador del Mundo is in its fourth cycle of the program committee of women, where everyone works and helps each other to succeed. The foundation has implemented the program of poverty elimination, which will help them to know their life situation, and accordingly be able to improve it and grow to help their loved ones.

One person who is known for their enthusiasm and desire to succeed and keep improving is Ms. Miriam. She sells clothing of all kinds and even though she knows the competition is very difficult today, in the same way she strives to grow and have the necessary means to help her family. 

Miriam is requesting this loan so she may continue with her work as she has been doing, struggling and striving for improvement. She wants to buy various items such as jeans, shirts, pants, jackets, blouses, and others.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, pants, jackets, blouses, and others.

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Deisy es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, con una visión y unas metas por cumplir. Sueña con poder ejercer su profesión, y poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten de ella.
Comenta que con lucha y sacrificio esta estudiando. Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder estudiar y progresar.
texts.en: Deisy is from the city of Carapegua. She is studying to be a nurse, and has a vision and goals she wants to achieve. She dreams of being able to work in her profession and to be able to help people who need it. She says that her studies require sacrifice and hard work. She asks for this loan to be able to meet the fees from her university courses so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 21-year-old single man who started providing his own electricity maintenance services in 2010. He was only sixteen when he started his own business and today he is working hard to expand and develop his business properly.

Today, he has eight years of experience in his domain, since he left school during his intermediate level and decided to start his own business to support his family in their living.

Mohamad is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy updated tools to develop his business and expand his working sector. He hopes to expand his work to cover nearby villages and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy updated tools to develop his business and expand his working sector

loans.name: Maminiaina Lovasoa

texts.fr:
Maminiaina est un homme responsable très conscient de ses devoirs vis à vis de sa famille. Il est débrouillard, il ne se contente pas d'une seule activité, il ne cesse pas de chercher d'autres sources de revenu.
Son principale activité génératrice de revenu est l'achat et revente des chaussures à l'occasion et des chaussures neuves pour dames de fabrication chinoise. C'est celle qui est l'objet de son emprunt et qu'il veut à tout prix développer et étendre. En plus, il est agent immobilier informel, puis il fait des petits boulots et bricole par-ci et par-là  car sa femme peut à tout moment l'aider dans la vente des chaussures.
Son objectif est d'épargner davantage (construire un matelas d'épargne) afin de réaliser son rêve de construire sa propre maison. Il en a marre de louer et de déménager à chaque fois que le proprio a besoin de sa maison selon ses dires.
texts.en:
Maminiaina is a conscientious person taking his responsibilities towards his family very seriously. He is persevering and keeps searching for new sources of income not limiting himself to a single type of business.

His main source of income is buying and reselling  shoes, both used shoes and new women's shoes made in China. This loan will be used to grow his show business, which he wants to see grow and take off. In addition, Maminiaina also works as an informal real estate agent, takes on  various odd jobs and some repair work, whatever may turn up, as his wife can always step in to help him with selling shoes.

His goal is to be able to save more (to grow his savings funds) in order to achieve his dream to build his own house. He is tired of renting and then having to move each time the proprietor claims to need the house for his own use again.

loans.use: to buy used men's shoes and new "made in China" women's shoes.

loans.name: Kyeni Kya Mukuyuni Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Salome, a member of Kyeni Kya Mukuyuni. She is married and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 and received training on savings and Resource Mobilization and was able to start a grocery shop out of her own savings.

Salome is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, hence increasing the stock in her grocery shop for an increased income. She will also be able to meet her customers' demands with the increased stock.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to increase stock in her grocery shop for increased income.

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan hails from the town of Dulag, Leyte. He is a 31-year-old married man with a one-year-old dependent. He raises and sells hogs.  He has been raising hogs for a year now. He needs funds to be able to finance his livelihood.

He is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. These are very essential tools that would improve his hog-raising livelihood.  With that, he could raise and sell healthy hogs in a few months to come. Thus, his earnings would improve. He could now set aside some money for emergency use. 

He is grateful for the loan he availed, and he is doing his best to expand his current source of income to be sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Fisal

texts.en:
Fisal is a 21-year-old single man from a village near Jenin City. He lives with his family in a small humble house. His father is the sole source of income for the family, and he earn a low income. 

Fisal is a student at a local university, where he studies accounting. He took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to pay university fees for this semester. This will help him complete his study and find a suitable job in the future.

Fisal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Zhamyila

texts.ru: Жамыйла, 48 лет, замужем. У нее высшее образование, с 1992 года она занимается животноводством и полеводством, по хозяйству помогают супруг и тесть. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется корова, 1,50 Га, где она выращивает картофель и фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамыйла обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита помогут Жамыйле в дальнейшем увеличивать поголовье скота и построить забор у дома.
texts.en:
Zhamiyla is 48 years old and married. She has a college degree. Since 1992 she has been raising livestock and growing farm crops. Her husband and father-in-law help her on the farm. Thanks to Zhamiyla's hard work, she now has a cow on her farm; she also has  a field of 1.5 ha [3.7 acres], where she grows potatoes and beans for own consumption and resale. 

In order to develop her business further, Zhamiyla has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KGS to buy a cow. The resulting reviews will allow Zhamiyla to keep increasing her headcount and also to build a fence by her house.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bags of carrots, cabbage, and eggplant for resale.

loans.name: God's Hand 1 Group

texts.en:
These seven members, led by Francisca as the representative, are part of the group called God's Hand. The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include selling assorted jeans, grocery, charcoal, fruits, wigs, cosmetics, mineral water, and drinks. They will need a total amount of GHS 11,100 to expand their businesses.

The loan will benefit this group of micro-businesswomen, of which Francisca is a member. Francisca says that she joined ID-Ghana four years ago and became a founding member of this group. This is her sixth loan request with ID-Ghana. She currently has a business selling assorted mineral water. Francisca will use her part of this loan, GHS 1100, to increase her capital. She will buy more assorted mineral water to sell to customers. She will sell them at her residence to her customers. This work allows her to make an income for her family.

Francisca is 52 years old, single and has two children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Francisca replied that she likes the health insurance services and the training sessions. She says her loans have made it possible to take care of her children and her needs by saving part of her profits and reinvesting the other part in her business.

loans.use: to buy more assorted mineral water to sell to her customers. She will sell them at her residence.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta estudiando la carrera de derecho, quiere poder ser un gran profesional que pueda ser útil a las demás personas, el está poniendo todo de si para poder crecer y salir adelante. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas y poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Gerardo is from San Lorenzo. He is studying law and hopes to be a great professional who can be of use to other people. He is putting all of himself into his work so that he can grow and get ahead. He says that he used his previous loan to pay the costs of his classes, which was very helpful.

He is asking for a loan to once again pay his university fees and be able to continue with his studies. He is grateful for this new opportunity to keep up with his schooling.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.es:
Nidia es estudiante de la carrera de Medicina, está estudiando para poder superarse y poder ser alguien en la vida. 
Ella quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas en algo tan importante como es la salud. Está poniendo todo de sí para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar la matrícula de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Nidia is a medical student. She is studying so that she can improve herself and be someone. She wants to be able to help other people with something as important as their health. She is putting everything she has towards becoming someone. She asks for help to pay her university fees so that she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is 49-year-old single lady who has worked hard since 2003 selling gifts and toys in her village to support another member of her family in covering their living needs.

Zeina is a hard working lady who puts so much effort into developing her business. Unfortunately, increasing living needs stop her from planning for future development. That's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with special summer beach needs and selected items which are highly requested by her customers.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business in a well-managed way and to reply to her customers' diversified needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special summer beach needs and selected items which are highly requested by her customers.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita, is aged 62, widowed and has three children. She sells fruits and vegetables in their village for almost  5 years and earns a net income of PHP 800 weekly. Her net profit in her business was spent on the school allowances of her grandchildren. Due to insufficient capital to her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to purchase pomelo, banana, and vegetables to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase pomelo, banana, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase metal rods and metal steels for making steel windows and doors for his demanding customers and meet their demands.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 44 years old, married and he supports seven family members. He has been supplying welding products for the last 15 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 14,000. 

Thomas has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more metals for use in his work so he can earn more income. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan, expand his business and recruit more staff. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more metals for use in his work so he can earn more income.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking woman from Mcarthur, Leyte. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling assorted goods such as bread, shampoo, seasonings, powdered soap, biscuits and many others. She is a 43-year-old woman with children aged 9-17 years old. Her husband earns a living by farming.

She is asking for a loan to buy various stocks for the store like soft drinks, noodles, canned goods and toiletries. This would improve the content of her store and she would be able to serve a wide array of goods to her respective buyers. Thus, her income will increase and she would be able to settle her obligations.

Rosemarie is eager to manage her business successfully for the improvement of the family's living conditions and also to provide for the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy various stocks for her store.

loans.name: Turdali

texts.en:
Turdali is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1954. He is living in a rural area with his family. He is married and has one child. As a head of a family, he is responsible to work and feed his family. He does a business in agriculture and his wife supports him to do business. His son is married and lives with them; they have two young children. 

Turdali wants to help his son and works hard to have a good harvest from agriculture. Last year he planted onions and watermelons in his yard, but unfortunately because of a dry season he could not gain a good harvest. That earning was spending only for winter expenditures to his family. Now, he is planning to process the land with fertilizer and natural chemicals to have a good harvest. He asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds. He awaits your kindness and hopes this year he will have a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica es estudiante de la carrera de Nutrición, tiene una hija de dos años, trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo, para poder ser el ejemplo de su hija.
Ella esta luchando y se esfuerza por poder crecer y ser alguien de provecho en la vida. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Jessica is getting a degree in Nutrition. She has a two year old daughter. She works and goes to school at the same time, in order to set an example for her daughter. She is fighting and working hard so that she can grow and be a good person. She is grateful for this opportunity to be able to continue her studies. She asks for a loan to pay her university fees so that she can stay in school.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of flour for making mandazi and chapati to sell to his clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar to sell in her shop and meet the demands of her clients and her family's needs.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 20-year-old single man from Bethlehem City. He lives with his family in a small humble house. His parents work in the public sector, where they get low and unstable income. Ahmad is a student in a local university where he studies law. He took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to pay university fees for this semester. This will help him complete his studies and find a suitable job in the future. Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay university fees for this semester

loans.name: Roise

texts.en:
Roise is 56 years old and she supports six family members.

She has been selling clothes in the market for the last 21 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to purchase stocks of clothes for sale in the market and to meet the demands of her clients and her family's needs.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children.  

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothes for sale in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs as stock for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more t-shirts and printing pastes to design and print more t-shirts  to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of foodstuffs to sell in the market and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel, who deals in produce, is a hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He supplements his incomes with farming, having engaged in the business in 2000. He started to look after his family especially by paying school fees for his children. In his business he faces a challenge of bad weather, mainly the rainy season when roads are so bad that he has to spend a lot on transport costs. Although Emmanuel faces that difficulty, he is working hard toward achieving his dream of educating his children, since he didn’t go to school. He is seeking credit to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugarcane to sell in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to make more furniture to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es:
Jonathan es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, comenta que gracias a sus padres que le inculcaron valores, él pone todo de su para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
El está poniendo todo de si para poder salir adelante y ser un profesional exitoso, que sea de ayuda a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Jonathan is from the city of Villa Elisa. He is studying to be a nurse. He says that his parents taught him his values. He puts everything of himself into growing and becoming a good person. He is working to get ahead and become a successful professional so that he can be of help to others. He asks for a loan to pay his university fees so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
Arnaldo esta estudiando para ser ingeniero agropecuario, sigue estudiando y trabajando y comenta que aunque es muy sacrificado hacer ambas cosas, lo hace para poder crecer y salir adelante. El es una persona muy trabajadora que esta luchando para poder ser alguien en la vida y ser útil a la sociedad. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le fue muy útil.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Arnaldo is studying to be an agricultural engineer. He continues to study and work at the same time, and he says that even though he has to sacrifice, he does it so he can grow and succeed.

He is a very hard-working person who is fighting to be able to be someone in life and be useful to society.

He says that he used his previous loan to pay college fees, which was very useful to him. Today he is again requesting this loan to be able to pay back his college tuition, so that he can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay college costs

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en: Haydar is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1964. He is living in a rural area. He is married and has four children. He is one of the active people in his village. He does a business of keeping livestock and planting agriculture. He has many years practice doing business in agriculture. He and his wife decided to improve their livestock business. Now they have six livestock and want to have more. Haydar is asking for a loan to buy livestock and grow his business. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders. His business helps him to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and grow his business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 34 years old, married to Eunice and supports three family members. 

He has been practicing farming for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 8,000 per month. He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to improve his farming by applying modern farming technology to increase productivity. 

He plans to use the profit earned to repay the loan and expand his farming activity. 

His hope is to have a stable life.

loans.use: To improve his farming by applying modern farming technology to increase productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of maize to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees .

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros engages in a hog-raising business. She raises and sells hogs as her main source of income. Aside from that, she also grows tilapia and sold (freshwater cichlid fish), to have supplemental income. She is a 58-year-old married woman with four dependents. Two of her children are still attending school.

Milagros has requested a loan to buy pig feeds and supplement. These are very helpful tools that would help boost her hog-raising business. With these, she will be raising quality hogs and slowly improve her earnings. She could now able to continue to finance the schooling of her children and do some expansion with her current source of income.

She is grateful for the loan she has requested, as it really inspires her to handle her existing business for the better and for the welfare of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds and supplement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees for his master's degree

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is 29 years old and he supports four family members. He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last five years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 13,000. 

Bonface has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow, so as to supply milk to potential customers in his area, in order to realize more profits from both businesses.

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children.
  
His hope is to be financially stable and expand his businesses.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk to potential customers in his area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to enable him to sew more clothes

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Issouf est la personne qui  tient la corde des moutons sur la photo, il est emboucheur âgé de 40 ans au Mali où il habite avec sa femme et ses 10 enfants  âgés  de 1 à 22 ans. Parmi ses enfants un seul fréquente l’école Coranique.                                                                                                                                 
Il exerce son activité d’emboucheur depuis plus de 9 ans. Issouf achète ses moutons  au marché local, les engraisse puis  les  revend au même  marché.
 Les autres membres sur la photo,  exercent le même métier d’emboucheur. C’est un groupe  de solidarité constitué de 7 personnes. Ils  font recourt  aux services  du RMCR  pour pratiquer leur activité d’embouche ovine.                                                                                                                                                                           
Le groupe a sollicité un prêt pour acheter plus de moutons. 
Issouf  a besoin d’un montant conséquent afin d’élargir son activité d’embouche. Avec  ce  prêt, il  rêve  de conquérir les grands marchés de bétail de la ville.  Ce prêt l’aidera  à répondre  à l’autosuffisance alimentaire ainsi que la santé des Enfants.
texts.en:
Issouf is the person holding the sheep by the rope on the photo. He is a 40-year-old animal fattener in Mali, where he lives with his wife and 10 children, from one to 22 years old. Among his children one attends Koranic school.

He has been in the animal fattening business for over nine years. Issouf buys sheep at the local market, fattens and sells them at the same market.

The other members in the photo also fatten animals. This is a solidarity group consisting of seven persons. They call upon the services of RMCR to help with their sheep fattening activity. The group applied for a loan to buy more sheep.

Issouf needs a significant amount to expand his fattening activity. With this loan, he dreams of conquering the big cattle markets in the city. This loan will help him attain food self-sufficiency and ensure his children's health.

loans.use: buy sheep to fatten and resell

loans.name: Twungubumwe I Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine  fait partie du groupe  Twungubumwe et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 34 ans et est mariée à Emmanuel, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, tous étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants membres  de sa famille élargie, qui étudient. 

Elle est son seizième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière locale à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jeanine  is a member of the Twungubumwe group and lives in Gitega. She is 34 years old and is married to Emmanuel, a farmer. They have three children who all go to school. She also has two dependent children from her extended family that also go to school. 

This is her 16th loan with Turame. With her Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of local beer that she’ll resell to earn more.

loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large quantity of local beer that she’ll resell to earn more.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a resident of Kagadi, dealing in produce buying and selling. He also does farming for additional income, a business he started in 2001 with an aim of making money to be used to look after his family’s increasing demands. Having used the previous loan to buy maize to sell, he managed to get profits. He now wishes to achieve his greatest desire of educating his children to university, despite the hardship of heavy rains that hinder his service delivery. He will use the loan facility to buy more stock of maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize to sell.

loans.name: Fawziya

texts.en: Fawziya is a 22-year-old single lady from a small village near Tulkarm. She lives with her family in a small humble house. Her father works as a taxi driver where he gets a low and unstable income. Fawziya studies sociology at a Palestinian university. She took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to pay university fees.  Fawziya will be able to achieve her dream to be a social worker in the future. Fawziya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: increase her capital and buy a large amount of clothing that she’ll resell to earn more.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 41-year-old married woman. She has three children. The man shown in the photo is her husband who deals in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way, he earns sufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. 

In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Sajida has applied for a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR for the growth of her husband's business. He then was able to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy bananas, avocados, persimmons, oranges, tangerines, guavas, mangoes, pineapples, granadillas, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, onions, ...

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old, married with two children who are both in school.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other personal care products.

Vilma has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Vilma aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 37 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chona is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her feeds.

Chona has been raising pigs  for seven years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock in her business so as to meet the demand from clients and raise more income.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cheryl is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Cheryl has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Cheryl has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Cheryl would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a divorced woman and has been blessed with six children  who one  attend school. Together with her children they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over seven years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place place of operation hence leading to losses.
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Komal

texts.en:
Komal is a 24-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. The income generated by her husband is not sufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her own business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income.  

For the improvement of her business, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another cow to increase her sales, which will ultimately will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to increase her sales

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en:
Imtiaz is a married lady. Her brother-in-law is shown in the photo with her. She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells their milk for additional income. 

For the improvement of her business, Imtiaz has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Akhtar  Jan

texts.en: Akhtar Jan, aged 52, is a hard working woman. She is in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. Akhtar Jan needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and availed a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more animals to expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 26-year-old lady from Kakamega. She is married and supports 5 people in her family. She is blessed with 2 children who are 2 and 6 years old.

She operates a motorbike transportation business. She has been doing this for the last 4 years, generating a monthly income of KES 13,800.

Violet has applied for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase a new motorbike so that she can support her family and expand her business. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her transportation business

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo lives at Tuguegarao with his wife and two children. He is a tricycle driver and offers transport business to the people in his village. He wanted to keep offering safe travel so he is now asking for a loan of P9,000 to buy gasoline and maintenance of the motorcycle. He hopes to maintain his business and save fund for family's expenses. He also promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and maintainance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en: Genie is 52 years old, married and had three grown-up children. She is a vendor selling books for income.  Before, Genie sells snacks but decided to stop it and focus only in her book-selling business. She hopes to keep acquiring more income in her business now that is why she is borrowing additional capital of P20,000. She will purchase more books (story books, dictionary, atlas) to sell. Someday, she hopes to keep acquiring good profits to use in case of emergency.

loans.use: to purchase more books (story books, dictionary, atlas) to sell

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 63 years old, married and has three children. 

Edita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Edita requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Edita has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alicia is 50 years old and has one child who is in school.

Alicia has a general store business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Alicia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Mosi

texts.en:
Mosi is a married woman with four kids whom all attend school.She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years she has operated cafe business selling food  selling to the community and people at the market.She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation .With the loan she wants to purchase cooking oil,wheat flour and beans for her business.She decided to join yehu  to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil,wheat flour and beans

loans.name: Guyathe

texts.en:
Guyathe is a widowed mother  of six  children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants   to purchase two sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Meali

texts.en:
Meali is a married woman and staying together with her husband and two children. She lives at  a rental house that  has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven months, she has operated a paraffin selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier .
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more stock of paraffin for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of paraffin for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attends school. She lives at a own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 43-year-old married woman. She has two children. The man shown in the photo is her husband. When she realized that her husband's income was not sufficient to meet all the household expenditures with ease, she and her husband took the initiative of starting a goat selling business. She earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  

For the improvement of her business, she has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats. She aspires to save money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Amida

texts.en:
Amida is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, paraffin, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, paraffin, and cooking fat

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a single mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is a 38-year-old, married woman.  

She deals in business selling goats in her community. She works along with her husband who is also shown in the photo, and they currently have a few goats.

Noreen is keen to provide her family with a better standard of living. Therefore she has taken out a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000, which she has used to purchase more goats to sell in the market, in order to earn good profits and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more goats to sell in the market, in order to earn good profits and improve their standard of living.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

Mary has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Umunezero Group

texts.en:
Umunezero is a group led by Speratha, who is 25 years old. The group name means “Happiness” in English. The group members sell different items and they all have the same idea about changing their lives.

Speratha is married with one child who is one year old. She has a shop and has been running this business for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar; salt, maize flour and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar; salt, maize flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a shoes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 15,000 she wants to purchase bales of second hand shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children, all of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman; she has three children, all of whom attend school. Dorcas owns a house that  has electricity  but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Dorcas has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Wanza

texts.en:
Wanza is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation and seasonality in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Je Ye Se Kola Group

texts.fr:
Djénéba est la femme qui tient les cordes de la brebis et la chèvre sur la photo
Malienne, Djénéba  est âgée de 65 ans .Elle n’a pas été à l’école. Mariée, elle est mère de 4 enfants dont un garçon scolarisé . Ménagère, son mari   est un cultivateur. Son rêve est d’acheter une paire de bœufs et une charrue pour ses enfants afin de garantir leur avenir dans l’agriculture et avec comme espoir le prêt qu’elle  prend au R M C R.. Elle prend le prêt au RMCR pour acheter des chèvres et moutons pour l’élevage. Elle s’approvisionne au marché environnant et vend au même marché après l’engraissement. Le bénéfice récolté sur la vente des chèvres et moutons la permet de prendre en charge : la santé, la nourriture et l’habillement de ses enfants. Elle déclare n’avoir pas eu de problème avec le prêt du RMCR. elle compte s’encourager dans mon activité d’élevage et faciliter l’agriculture afin de satisfaire suffisamment ma vie et celle des membres de ma famille.
texts.en:
Djénéba is seen in the photo holding the sheep and the goat.  She is 65 years old, married and has four children.  One of her sons attends school.  Djénéba did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She is married to a farmer.  Her dream is to buy a pair of oxen and a plow to ensure her children a future in agriculture.

Djénéba will use her loan from the field partner, RMCR, to buy goats and sheep to raise.  She buys and sells her livestock at the same local market.  Her profits will enable her to pay for healthcare, food and clothing for her children.  She has had no problems with her loan from RMCR and she relies on them to support her in her livestock and agriculture business.  This will help her provide for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman and staying together with her husband and eight children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman and staying together with her husband four children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mwanaula

texts.en:
Mwanaula is  a married and has four school going children. They own a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Esther has operated a business of selling renting houses to the  neighbours. In addition she also operates a phone charging business which earns her other source of income. She faces a challenge of delayed payments hence low profits in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting she wants to establish another rental houses, purchase cements and sand for construction. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase cements and sand for construction.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira, 36 years old, is a very enthusiastic person. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. For this reason, Saira has requested a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR for her husband, who will buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to enable her husband to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of medical drugs, pills and syrup to sell in her pharmacy, which she hopes will enable her to serve more customers

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina who is 54 years old, supports a family of 6 members. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 10 years earning an income of 9,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to boost her farming through application of modern farming technology to increase production for more income.

She plans to use the gained profits to expand her farming activity as well as starting a small retail business. 

Her future hope is to live a decent life.

loans.use: to boost her farming through application of modern farming technology to increase production for more income.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married mother of one child who does not  attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes for resale

loans.name: Rustico

texts.en: Rustico is 50 years old, married and had two children. His youngest child is still in college. Rustico is a tricycle driver while his wife works abroad. Rustico wanted to keep improving his transport business but had insufficient fund to make some necessary repairs in his motorcycle. He is now asking for a loan of P9,000 to overhaul his motorcycle unit and maintenance of it. Someday, he hopes to keep rendering safe travel to all his passengers and gain good profits in it.

loans.use: to overhaul his motorcycle unit and maintenance of it.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Adama est le client qui a ses mains sur le bélier.
Agé de quarante-deux ans (42ans) Adama est un  emboucheur malien des ovins. Marié, père de quatorze (14) enfants dont quatre (04) écoliers. Adama n’a pas été à l’école mais il a fréquenté le centre Alphabétisation de son village. Adama a fait recourt au RMCR pour  soutenir et renforcer ses activités. Il achète ses béliers et ses céréales dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Avec son prêt, il achète des béliers pour les engraisser, les aliments bétails, les céréales (mil, maïs) et les fers ( revendre aux forgerons de sa zone). Adama fait ses ventes dans les mêmes foires hebdomadaires de sa zone. Il fait un bénéfice variant entre 200 000 à 350 000 FCFA par cycle de prêt. Adama fait l’embouche depuis plus de 17 ans. Grâce au soutien  du RMCR, ses activités marchent  bien. Ce qui lui plaisent beaucoup dans ses activités (embouche et vente des céréales) en est qu’elles génèrent assez de profits. Adama ne se plaint pas trop seulement souvent les béliers crèvent malgré les entretiens
texts.en:
Adama is seen in the photo holding the goat.  He is 42 years old, married and father to fourteen children, four of whom attend school.  He never had the opportunity to go to school but he has attended a reading class in his village.

Adama has been raising sheep and goats for seventeen years, and works with the field partner, RMCR, to strengthen his business. He buys and sells his livestock and cereals from weekly markets in his area.  His loan will buy livestock, animal feed, cereals (millet and maize) and iron (to resell to blacksmiths in his area).  He makes between 200,000 francs CFA and 350,000 francs CFA over a loan cycle.

Thanks to the support he receives from RMCR, Adama's business is working well.  He is very pleased that he is able to make enough money and his only complaint is that his animals sometimes die even though he takes good care of them.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for fatting up and resale.

loans.name: Tunezerwe Group

texts.fr:
Capitoline  fait partie du groupe  Tunezerwe et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 54 ans et est mariée à Thérance, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants dont  2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de Banane et de petit pois  depuis  15ans. 

Elle est à son dix-huitième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de petits pois et de bananes  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Capitoline is a member of the Tunezerwe Group and lives in Gitega.  She is 54 years old and married to Thérance, a farmer.  Together they have three children, two of whom attend school.  She has been selling peas and bananas for fifteen years.

This will be Capitoline's eighteenth loan with the field partner, Turame.  It will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of peas and bananas for resale.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of peas and bananas to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 41 years old and he supports 11 family members. 

He has been a dairy farmer for the last eight years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which he plans to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his customers and meet their demand.  

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his customers and meet their demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a VU sewing machine for her sewing workshop

loans.name: Laurette Ismaelie

texts.fr:
Ismaelie a 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants de 10, 7 et 4 ans et ils vont tous à l'école. Son mari est menuisier à la tâche donc le revenu n'est pas stable. De ce fait, les deux époux trouvaient que le revenu procuré de la menuiserie ne parvenait pas à couvrir de temps en temps les besoins primaires de la famille donc ils ont décidé ensemble que c'est mieux si Ismalie exerce une autre activité, source de revenu.
Elle a démarré une petite épicerie en 2007, passionnée de son travail, elle désire le développer et l'étendre davantage. En plus dans leur village, il n'y a pas encore de concurrents. Ceci la motive vivement à travailler dur et continuer à investir.
Son projet est que son épicerie devienne un grand magasin général d'ici quelques temps.
texts.en:
Ismaelie is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are 4, 7, and 10 years old. All of her children go to school.

Her husband is a carpenter and his revenue isn’t stable. Realizing that his carpentry revenue wasn’t always covering their family's basic needs, the couple decided together that Ismaelie should start a business so they would have another revenue source.

She started a small grocery in 2007. She is passionate about her work and would like to grow and expand her business. She currently has no competitors in her village. This is the reason she continues to work hard and invest in her business.

Her goal is for her grocery store to become a large general store in a short amount of time.

loans.use: buy three bags of rice, one bag of sugar, and one bottle of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann hails from the town of Javier, Leyte. She engages in a hog-raising business.  She has been raising hogs for five years now.  She is a 40-year- old married woman with three children who are 20, 18 and 16 years old, respectively. She also engages in a food vending business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and use the additional capital for food vending. This will help improve Mary Ann's livelihood and make it more productive. With this loan, she will now be able to raise and sell quality hogs. Thus, she can also purchase more supplies for preparation for her food vending business. In this way, she can afford to buy nutritious diets and have a better shelter to live in.

In the future, she is determined to expand both of her sources of income for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and use the additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Vololoniaina Martine

texts.fr:
Martine a 32 ans, Elle est mariée et son mari travail comme chauffeur de taxi-bus. Elle est mère de deux enfants de 12 et 10 ans qui sont tous scolarisés.
Pour aider son mari à soutenir sa famille, Martine a décidé d'exercer une activité génératrice de revenu. Il s'agit de vente et livraison des œufs de poulet auprès des épiciers. 
Son rêve est de devenir grossiste dans ce domaine de commerce, c'est la raison pour laquelle, elle demande du crédit pour augmenter la quantité des œufs à vendre, en plus , elle vient d’acquérir de nouveaux clients.
En effet, elle veut continuer à investir davantage pour parvenir à ce rêve de devenir "grossiste".
A part ça, elle souhaite acheter un véhicule pour que son mari devienne chauffeur propriétaire afin que le revenu augmente.
texts.en:
Martine is 32 years old, married to a taxi-bus driver and mother to two children (ten and twelve years old), who both attend school.  To help her husband provide for their family, Martine sells and delivers eggs to shopkeepers.  Her dream is to become a wholesaler and this is why she has requested a loan.  She will buy a large quantity of eggs which will also satisfy her new customers.  She will continue to invest in order to reach her goal of being a wholesaler.

In the future, Martine would like to buy a vehicle so her husband can become a driver and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy 1,700 hens eggs for resale.

loans.name: Onisoa

texts.fr:
27 ans, célibataire, Onisoa habite avec ses parents. C'est lui qui prend en charge les 90 pourcents des dépenses familiales.
Après la fin de ses études universitaires en 2003, il a eu du mal à trouver du travail compatible avec son diplôme. De ce fait, il a décidé de suivre une formation en couture industrielle et d'ouvrir un petit  atelier de confection de sacs à dos.
Il a démarré avec un emprunt auprès de CEFOR en 2004, et il a bien remboursé ce prêt. Ensuite pour pouvoir honorer une commande spécifique et bien préparer la rentrée scolaire 2015-2016, il veut renouveler sa demande de crédit pour acheter des matières premières supplémentaires.
Son objectif pour cette année est de commencer vers le mois de juillet la construction de sa maison avec son épargne.
texts.en:
Onisoa is 27 years old, single and lives with his parents.  He is responsible for 90% of the income of his family.  When he finished his university studies in 2003, he found it impossible to find employment that would use his diploma.
