Therefore, he decided to retrain in industrial sewing and open a small workshop making back-packs.  He began his business in 2004 with a loan from the field partner, CEFOR, which he repaid fully and correctly.

Onisoa now has an order to fulfil, and would like to prepare for the coming school year 2015-2016.  He has, therefore, requested a new loan to buy more raw materials.  He hopes to be able to begin construction on a new home around July this year, this will be paid for by his savings.

loans.use: to buy 195m of polyester, 800m of strapping, 75m of lining and 15m of net for his bag manufacturing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline and maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Duaa

texts.en:
Duaa is a 22-year-old single lady from Qalqilya city. She lives with her family in a small humble house. Duaa's parents are public sector employees where they get a simple income. This income does not cover all the costs of the family. 

Duaa studies business administration at a local university in Palestine. She took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to pay university fees. By taking this loan Duaa will have a greater chance to enter the labor market in the future.

Duaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en: Maria Theresa, is aged 41, married to a sales agent, and they're blessed with three children. She owns and manages a food stall/food stand in their town for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 30,000 a month. Her net income on her business was spent on their daily expenses at home. Due to insufficient fund on her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to pay for the franchiser fee for her food stall business. She's hoping that her income will continue to improve and become more productive.

loans.use: To pay for the franchiser fee for her food stall business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en: Eliud is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be focused and disciplined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.He also sells motorcycle spare parts. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of motorcycle spares for sell. His business goal is to buy two more motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have good living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of motorcycle spares for sell

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en: Aneela is a 26-year-old married woman who has three children. The man shown in the picture is her husband. She started a business selling cloth in her locality. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells the cloth in her own town. She has a strong customer base. Currently, Aneela has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business.

loans.name: God's Hand 2 Group

texts.en:
God's Hand 2 Group is made up of five people who live in the same area. They sell bags, plastic products, pepper, charcoal and slippers. The group's representative, named Comfort, is 43 years old and has attended school to the elementary level. She is single with two children, both of whom go to school and are in her care. 

Comfort lives with her children, and she takes care of the various family expenses. For this reason, she has been buying and selling bags. She has been doing this business for the past 17 years. This enables her to provide for her family and for herself. Comfort gets her supplies from the market in Ghana. To bolster her business, Comfort, together with the other members of the group, is seeking a seventh loan from Kiva's partner, ID Ghana. 

They promise to work hard to repay this loan without trouble.

loans.use: to buy more assorted bags to sell to customers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be good . She operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in an area good for business and her primary customers are the general public. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice,flour and other items. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, rice,flour and other items

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: fatuma is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she offers computer services i.e browsing, typesetting. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy two more computers. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a prosperous business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy two more computers.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be opportunistic. She operates a retail business where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of medicine. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of medicine

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu is a  Kiva borrower. She has 9 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a prosperous business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be loyal. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar,soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to her customers.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be positive. He operates a farm where he grows maize, beans, peas, kales. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy seedlings and other items. His business goal is to be a supplier of maize within 5 years. he will use the anticipated profits to invest.

loans.use: buy seedlings and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more timber for sell

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: Ghazala is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is her brother-in-law. The income generated by her husband is not sufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her own business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income. For the improvement of her business, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 49-year-old married Palestinian refugee who has been working in her own house as a tailor for eight years to help her husband make a living and cover their needs. Asmaa has had experience in this field since 1990, where at the same time, she used to work as a nurse. But she looked for a business that she could run from her house to be able to take care of her husband and be easier for her to run. Her husband works as a taxi driver with a very low income. Asmaa has a very good reputation in her region, with her special talents and the customer service she provides. Since she didn't have the chance to be a mother, she works on developing her business in a well managed way to fill her time with something valuable. Asmaa puts much effort into developing and expanding her business, to make sure that she can remain capable of covering her family’s needs.

Asmaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her husband's official governmental Identification Card.

loans.use: To pay for her husband's official governmental Identification Card

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming through application of modern farming methods and using certified seeds to increase production for more income.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Philomena is a married women. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be sincere. He operates a beauty salon where he offers beauty services. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a conducive area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. His business goal is to have a great salon within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank . Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased sales. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank . Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock bread, sugar,cereals and other items

loans.name: Nense

texts.en:
Nense is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Nense is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nense requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nense has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nense would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 45 years old, married woman with one children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vicenta has a fishing business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Vicenta has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Fashamwenewanyu Group

texts.fr:
Dévote  fait partie du groupe  Fashamwenewanyu et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 28 ans et est mariée à Emmanuel, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 2enfants.
 
Elle fait le commerce de  riz, de l’huile de palme, et de charbon,  depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, de l'huile de palme et de charbon  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  augmenter le capital.
texts.en:
Devote is part of the Fashamwenewanyu group and lives in Gitega. She is 28 years old and is married to Emmanuel, a farmer. Together they have two children.

She has been trading rice, palm oil, and coal for the past eight years.

This is her fifth loan with Turame. SHe will use the Kiva loan to increase her working capital and a large quantity of rice, oil palm and coal for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, she would like to increase her working capital.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice, palm oil and coal for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Turambane Group

texts.fr:
Zacharie fait partie du groupe  Turambaneet  habite à  Gitega. Il a 45 ans et est marié à créscence, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants dont  3 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de bananes mures et des œufs depuis  12 ans. 

Il est à son septième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de bananes mures et d' œufs, à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Zacharie is part of the Turambaneet group and lives in Gitega. He is 45 years old and is married to Crescence, a crop farmer. Together they have five children, of whom three attend school.
 
He has been trading ripe bananas and eggs for the past 12 years.

He is on his seventh loan with Turame. He will use the Kiva loan to increase his working capital and buy lots of ripe bananas and eggs for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy ripe bananas and eggs for resale, to earn more

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment such as spanners, tubes, glue and other items for doing repairs on motorcycles

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be opportunistic. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables,cassava. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cassava. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more boxes of sweets, biscuits and juice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Inguvu Group

texts.fr:
Barnabé  fait partie du groupe  Inguvu et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 26 ans et est marié à Violette une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant.
 
Il fait le commerce de  la bière locale et de la viande  depuis  2 ans. 

Il est son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière  locale et de viande, à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Barnabe is part of the Inguvu group and lives in Gitega. He is 26 years old and is married to Violette, a crop farmer. Together they have one child.
 
He has been trading local beer and meat for the past two years.

This is his second credit loan with Turame. He will use the Kiva loan to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of local beer and meat for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of local beer and meat for resale, to earn more

loans.name: Nineza Group

texts.fr:
Appolinaire  fait partie du Niheza  Gasenyi et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 33ans et est marié à Générose, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants qui étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de haricot et maïs  depuis  18 ans. 

Il est son  deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de maïs et haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Appolinaire is part of the Niheza Gasenyi group and lives in Gitega. He is 33 years old and is married to Generose, a retail merchant. They have two children who attend school.
 
He has been trading beans and maize for the past 18 years.

This is his second credit loan with Turame. He will use the Kiva loan to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of maize and beans for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of maize and beans for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 30-year-old, single, Palestinian Refugee who has been working in a funfair since 2010. His work is very far from his house and he is suffering from transportation problems which then lead to problems at work with his boss. For this reason he has decided to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy a motorcycle that will help him to get to his work more easily.

This will be Hassan's fifth loan cycle from Al Majmoua. His previous loans helped him a lot to develop his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle that will help him to get to his work more easily.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en: Prudence is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows  maize, beans and other crops and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy fertilizer and pay labour costs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay labour costs

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 53 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Magdalina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Magdalina requested a PHP 28000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Magdalina has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Magdalina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a open air market and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be great and joyful.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Sougrenom Wend Group

texts.fr:
Madame JUSTINE KISWENSIDA est la représentante du groupe SOUGRENOM WEND. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 17 ans et le moins âgé à 14ans. 02 vont à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes en charge. 
Madame vend des fruits et des gâteaux depuis 15 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de fruit.
 Elle veut s’acheter 05 cartons de bananes, 02 cartons de pommes.
Madame compte utiliser ces bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce et contribuer aux frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante et ouvrir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Justine Kiswendisa represents the Sougrenom Wend group. She is the married mother of two children,  the eldest of whom is 17 and the youngest 14 years old. They both attend school, and she has seven persons under her care.

She has been selling fruit and cakes for the past 15 years. She resupplies at the fruit market, and wants to buy five crates of bananas and two crates of apples.

She intends to use her profits to expand her business and contribute towards her children's tuition fees. Her ambition is to become a great merchant and open her own shop.

loans.use: buy five crates of bananas and two crates of apples

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better future. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour,cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 44 years old and she lives in the frontier village Sevkar of Tavush region. Emma has vocational education; she graduated college with the specialty of accountant. In her native village she lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband on his track makes cargo transfers around the region. Emma many years worked at the very famous Ijavan city’s carpet factory, which now does not work but the carpets produced there are still very expansive, popular and it consider to be antiques. Now Emma is engaged in farming and agriculture only, and with her husband they take care of their farm cattle such as cows, calves and chickens. From her farm Emma sells dairy-products, meat and eggs and also her land’s harvest such as potato, cabbage, greens and pepper. All these Emma sells at the city wholesale market during the week. Emma wants to develop her farming and she has idea of starting swine breeding in her farm. So this Kiva loan Emma will use for the purchase of two pigs, animal fodder and she will also manage to organize spring sowing activities.

loans.use: for the purchase of two pigs, animal fodder and she will also manage to organize spring sowing activities

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 52 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Brenda works very hard to provide for them.

Brenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Brenda has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other personal care products. 

In the future Brenda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Husna

texts.en: Husna is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more fish and cooking pans. Her business goal is to the leading supplier of fish within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more fish and cooking pans

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds . She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, eggs, milks and yeast  to produce sweet bread and French bread

loans.name: Katana

texts.en: Katana is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds and seasonal changes. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be the best in business. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en: Aveik with his wife, his son and daughter-in-law lives in the frontier village Sevkar of Tavush region. Avetik many years worked as a driver, now he seasonally goes for an abroad works in Russian Federation and simultaneously runs farming and agriculture. In his farm Avetik has several cows and chickens. On his plot of land he cultivates potato, greens and tomato. His orchard is not rich, but it is cute and gives sweet harvest of apple, apricot and fig. All his farm products Avetik’s wife sells from their house. Avetik cares of his farm very properly since despite of his seasonal work income, farm income is constant and also useful for his family as well. This loan Avetik will use for the purchase of several piglets in order to start swine breeding and also he will buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of several piglets in order to start swine breeding and also he will buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Ludycard

texts.en: Ludycard is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather conditions. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine is 30 years old and she lives with her husband (he is a builder) and two school-aged children in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Armine has no higher education neither vocational, but she is skilled farmer instead and perfectly manages to take care of her farm cattle; in her farm she has cows, calves, bulls, a heifer, a pig, piglets, sheep, lambs and chickens. In such a rich farm the work is a lot and the day as she says is always too short to manage all the work that she plans. The sale of her farm products is also on her duty and she sell her farm milk, macun (national dairy-products) milk, cheese, curd, meat and eggs and also her land’s potato right from her house. With this loan amount of 600.000 Armenian drams Armenian drams she will buy one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a conducive area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of building stones. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successful.

loans.use: buy more stock of building stones.

loans.name: Daina

texts.en: Daina is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock  of beauty products. Her business goal is to open more business branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock  of beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman and has been blessed with four children who are all adults. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food . 

Susan operated a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 25 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business.Fatuma dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a single woman who has no children . She lives at a family  house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby.In addition she also she also operates a cosmetic shop. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 
With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase new of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase new of clothes for resale

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be positive minded. She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be dry season which affects milk production. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a freezer for storing milk. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy a freezer for storing milk

loans.name: Mjeni

texts.en:
Mjeni is a married woman with six kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mjeni operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and  high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 


With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children whom  all attend school. She lives at a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatly monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past five years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge at her place of operation.
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one child who attends school.She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and food.

She has operated the printing business for the past five years offering her services to the community and the campus students living around that place.She mentioned transportation as  major challenge in her place of operation.With the loan that she is requesting she wants to purchase five bundles of printing papers,toner and cater age.She decided to join yehu to get access to loan facilities and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five bundles of printing papers,toner and cater age

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with three children  and she  owns a house that  neither has piped water nor electricity.Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.
 
Agnes has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread

loans.name: Las Afortunadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Las Afortunadas está en el ciclo número 7 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Se ha hecho el semáforo de eliminación de pobreza con todas para poder ir mejorando la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elida quien es Modista, posee un Taller de Costura en su casa y se dedica a este trabajo desde hace tiempo, por lo tanto tiene mucha clientela en la zona, y es más que conocida con todo el trabajo que hace. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Elida  solicita  este préstamo para la compra de insumos y materiales para su taller, como telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Las Afortunadas (The happy) is in the 7th cycle of the Committee of Working Women program, where they all work and help each other to in order to continue progressing. 

They have signalled to eliminate poverty in order to be able to improve the situation of each member. 

One of the members is Elida, a dressmaker who owns a sewing workshops in her house and has been earning a living doing this for a long time. This is why she has many clients in her zone, and she becomes more well known with all of the work that she does.

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to improve her daily life.

Elida is asking for this loan to purchase supplies and materials for her workshop, such as fabrics, threads and rubber amongst others, with this she will be able to continue with her production as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, and rubber

loans.name: Yesenia Beatriz

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 22 años de edad, vive muy feliz en su lugar de residencia que es humilde y acogedora, junto con su compañero de vida. Ella es una mujer luchadora y laboriosa que se dedica a la venta de leche de vaca y elaboración de sus derivados como: queso, requesón, crema, los cuales comercializa entre sus clientes, con la venta realizada logra suplir algunas necesidades básicas, por que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ganado bovino y así poder tener más leche para la elaboración de sus productos en forma artesanal y lograr salir adelante con el día a día para lograr sostener sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en: Yesenia is 22 years old. She lives very happily with her life's companion in her home, which is humble and cozy. She is a hardworking woman who is a fighter. She sells cow's milk and makes dairy products such as cheese, cottage cheese, and cream, who she also sells to her customers. With her sales she is able to cover some basic needs. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cattle to have more milk to make her products artesanally and get ahead day to day to be able to cover her basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cattle for milk production.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 4° Del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación como un medio de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marli, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, ella siempre hace todo lo mejor para poder crecer y mejorar y también para poder ser el ejemplo para sus demás compañeras. Marli se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y comenta que por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener y evitar que pase por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Mujeres Unidas is in its fourth women's committee loan cycle.  The members are participating in a poverty elimination program to improve their families' living conditions.

One of the members is Marli who is the president of the group.  She always does the best she can to grow and improve while service as an example to the other members.  Marli sells all kinds of clothing and says through her work she is able to give her loved ones the things she was unable to have, so they lack for nothing.

She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of clothing to sell, such as shorts, jeans, shirts, pants and other items.  This is so she can continue the work she has been doing until now.  She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as shorts, jeans, shirts, pants and other items to sell.

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Carlos es un grupo nuevo, está en su ciclo 1, del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo emprendedora. Todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Ramona, una de las personas que integra este grupo, se destaca por ser una persona muy entusiasta, que pone lo mejor de sí en cada reunión y en cada capacitación para poder crecer y mejorar y con ello poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. 
Ramona pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados, ya que con ello podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y de esa forma continuar ayudando a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group called San Carlos is a new group. It is in its 1rst cycle of the poverty elimination program. They are hardworking women who are above all enterprising.  They are all putting their best efforts into improving their quality of life.

Ramona is one of the people who make up this group. She stands out as a person who is very enthusiastic who gives the best of herself in every meeting and training to be able to grow and improve and thus help her family and loved ones. 

Ramona is asking for this loan to be able to buy various cosmetics so she can continue with her sales the way she has been doing. This way, she can continue helping her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Comité San Cayetano está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ella amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Caaguazú, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer su situación de vida, y conforme a ello poder luchar por mejorarla.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gabina, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas, ella es muy buena en las ventas, es por ello que ya tiene una clientela formada,  comenta que pese a los contratiempos que puedan surgir a diario, ella pone su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando y tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, blusas, jeans, abrigos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank group called Comite San Cayetano comprises 17 members who are all friends and neighbors in the city of Caaguazu.  They also participate in the poverty elimination program to understand what situation they are in so they can work to improve it.

One of the members is Gabina who sells clothing.  She is very good at sales and has a steady customer base.  She says that despite the obstacles that may arise daily, she puts all her effort into improving and earning more income to help her family.

The loan she is requesting is to buy shorts, shirts, blouses, jeans, coats and other items so she can continue her sales activity as she has done to date.  She is grateful for the opportunity to be a success in life and help her family.

loans.use: To buy shorts, shirts, blouses, jeans, coats and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools for his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Amada

texts.es: Amada tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 14 años de edad. Amada es una mujer muy trabajadora y con espíritu emprendedor luego de la pérdida de su esposo  hace algunos años y que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su hija brindándole protección. Amada se dedica a los oficios domésticos  y además tiene una pequeña pensión. Ella desea construir una pila y un baño para el cual no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios y ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y mano de obra para construir una pila y un baño en su vivienda.
texts.en: Amada is 52 years old. She lives in her own house with her 14 year old daughter. Amada is a very hardworking woman with an entrepreneurial spirit. After losing her husband a few years ago and with a lot of hard work she has gotten her daughter ahead and protected her. Amada takes care of her home and she also has a small pension. She wants to build a sink and a bathroom and she doesn't have the necessary financial resources. She has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in bricks, cement, sand, iron and labor to build a sink and a bathroom in her house.

loans.use: to invest in bricks, cement, sand, iron and labor to build a sink and a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Kuña Yuky Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Yuky  está saliendo adelante por medio de la unión de todas, y las ganas que tiene de poder crecer y mejorar. Todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con sacrificio y lucha vienen mejorando.
Todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo, están muy entusiasmadas y ponen lo mejor de si, pero entre todas se destaca la Sra. Mercedes, quien tiene una despensa en la que todos los días, es una mujer muy emprendedora, y comenta que empezó con muy poco, y que hoy en día ya ha crecido bastante y tiene ya una clientela bien formada. Está luchando para poder seguir creciendo,  es por eso que pone su mejor esfuerzo en las capacitaciones para poder aplicarlas.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con todo tipo de insumos, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, bebidas, lácteos y demás, y con ello poder seguir con su negocio y con sus ventas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que le permitirá ir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
The Kuña Yuky group is getting ahead through working together and wanting to be able to grow and improve. All of them are in the poverty elimination program and by sacrificing and fighting they are improving.

All of them are giving their best efforts and they are very enthusiastic and giving the best of themselves. Among them, Mercedes stands out. She has a store. She is a very entrepreneurial woman and she says that she started with very little. Today she has grown a lot and has a very loyal clientele. She is fighting to be able to keep growing. That is why she puts her best effort into the trainings so in the future she can apply them.  

She is asking for this loan to stock her business with all types of products, such as vegetables, meat, fruit, beverages, dairy products and more. With it, she will be able to continue with her business and her sales. She is thankful for this opportunity, which will allow her to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy products such as vegetables, meat, fruit, beverages, dairy products and more to stock her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas 2 está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, es un grupo muy unido donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Elva, una de las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Es una mujer muy emprendedora que quiere luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser: verduras, carne, pollo, jamón, queso y otros, y con ello poder seguir luchando por mejorar cada día. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer para mejorar con su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Mujeres Unidas 2 is taking part in the poverty elimination program.  It is a very united group where all the members make their best effort to overcome their situation of poverty.

Elva is one of the members of the group and she makes food that she sells as a street vendor.  She is very enterprising and determined to improve the living conditions of her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies to continue with her food business, such as vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese and other goods so she can continue to work to improve her situation on a daily basis.  She is grateful for this opportunity to grow and improve along with her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese and other items to make food.

loans.name: Levik

texts.en: Levik is 63 years old and he lives with his wife in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. His daughter is married and she lives with her family and his son is out for an abroad works. Levik has higher education and specialty of veterinary and being good specialist many years he worked of his specialty in his region. Now he is farmer in his cute and nice farm. Here he has cows, calves and bulls. Levik’s wife organizes the sale of their farm products and also the sale of the harvest of their land such as potato, greens, cabbage and onions. Levik asks a loan 700.000 Armenian drams since he wants to buy two pigs, potato seedlings and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two pigs, potato seedlings and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité  Mujeres Unidas, es un grupo que tiene muchas expectativas de poder crecer y salir adelante, son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Eva, quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes, está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar cada día. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere capacitarse para poder mejorar en su emprendimiento para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de los ingresos que pueda tener. 
Eva pide este préstamo para poder comprar perfumes para la venta, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas y tener así los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe día a día de mejorar y capacitarse.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas committee is a group that has a lot of expectations to grow and get ahead. They are very hardworking women who are fighters and who want to improve their and their families' living conditions. 

Eva, who sells perfumes, is giving the best of herself to be able to grow and improve every day. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who wants to train to be better in her business so she can help her family with the income she can get. 
 
Eva is asking for this loan to be able to buy perfumes to sell and with it continue with her sales and thus have the means to help her loved ones. She is thankful for the opportunity she gets every day to improve and train.

loans.use: to buy various perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa 1 forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas se unieron para poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. María es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas varias, ella tiene muchos clientes ya que siempre tiene su negocio bien surtido, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante. María está luchando por capacitarse y mejorar para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas varias para la venta, como ser cervezas, gaseosas, vinos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorar por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The communal bank group Kuña Guapa 1 is participating in the poverty elimination program.  All the members work together to get ahead and help their families and loved ones.

Maria is one of the members and she sells a variety of beverages.  She has many customers because her business is always well stocked.  She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who wishes to get ahead.  She strives to get training and progress so she can help her loved ones.

The loan she is requesting is to buy a variety of beverages to sell, such as beer, sodas, wine and others.  This will allow her to continue her sales activity as she has done until now.  She is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing and improving her situation for the sake of her loved ones.

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell such as beer, sodas, wines and others.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren is 38 years old and he lives in the village Zovaber of Gegharkunik region. He is married and he lives with his wife and two school-aged children. Suren now is contractual military serviceman and he cooperates his work with his farming. Now in his farm Suren has a cow, a calf, a pig, sheep and chickens. Suren’s wife managed to have regular customers for their farm products such as milk, cheese, curd, meat and eggs. Potato cultivation also brings some income to this family. Suren needs this loan as he decided to enlarge the number of his farm cattle with one more calf, he will also buy fodder for his farm cattle and also potato seedling, diesel fuel for his agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy one more calf,  fodder for his farm cattle and also potato seedling, diesel fuel for his agricultural activities

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
En total son 18 mujeres inspiradas que se esfuerzan día a día para solventar los gastos del hogar y por sobre todo aumentar sus ingresos, forman parte del comité con el fundamento de ayudarse y más bien consideran una oportunidad de suma importancia para ellas para trabajar y obtener sus propios ingresos.
La Sra. Francisca se siente agradecida e inspirada en esforzarse cada día por formar parte del comité que mediante eso ella pudo emprender su propio negocio que se basa en un almacén en su propia casa. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y sacrificada que quiere dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener y evitar de esa forma que pasen por necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, frutas, bebidas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
texts.en:
In all, 18 inspired women who work hard each day to cover their household expenses and, above all, to increase their income form the committee with the purpose to help themselves. They consider it a very important opportunity for them to work and get their own income.

Francisca is grateful and inspired in working hard each day to be part of the committee through which she could open her own business which is a grocery store in her own house. She is a very hard-working and self-sacrificing woman who wants to give her family everything she couldn't have and, in this way, prevent them from passing through difficulties. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase vegetables, meat, seasonings, fruit, drinks, baked goods, and more, so as to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, seasonings, fruit, drinks, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Vrezh

texts.en: Vrezh with his lovely wife lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. Vrezh many years worked as a driver in the village farm then again as a driver in private company. Now he is a farmer with his nice wife. Here they take care of cows, calves, bulls, pigs, sheep and chickens. Vrezh’s wife sells their farm’s milk, cheese, curd, meat and eggs mainly to their neighbors and regular customers. Vrezh mentions that he likes his present occupation and he also wants to develop it. As he mentions he is aware of Kiva program support and like many farmers he wants to start his farm development by the help of Kiva lenders. This loan Vrezh will use for the purchase of 6 more bulls for his farm which will greatly profitable his meat selling activities.

loans.use: or the purchase of 6 more bulls for his farm which will greatly profitable his meat selling activities

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado EMMANUEL está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las 17 mujeres se encuentran mejorando su calidad de vida saliendo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Antonia quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en una pobreza extrema. Se dedica a las ventas, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, bebidas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y crecer cada día. Antonia es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora que quiere salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group called Emmauel is in its second loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination tool where the 17 women are improving their quality of life getting out of the poverty line.

One of the members is Antonia who in her last questionnaire showed a poverty level within level one, which is to say that she is in extreme poverty. She works in sales and asks for this loan to be able to purchase clothing, drinks, and more, and in this way be able to continue with her sales. 

She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve and grow each day. Antonia is a very determined and enterprising woman who wants to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, drinks and more to sell.

loans.name: San Cayetano 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado San Cayetano 2 se encuentran en su ciclo numero 2 
El comité está conformado por mujeres alentadas por obtener un  mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de cada una de ellas que como objetivo es superar la pobreza en cada indicador y en su totalidad 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marciana se resalta en ella las ganas y deseos de superación dedicándose a su actividad de todos los días, el cual es la elaboración de artesanías. Con el préstamo que ella pide quiere comprar hilos, agujas, bastidores y demás, de manera a poder seguir con la elaboración de hamacas, sobrecamas y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder continuar con su humilde actividad.
texts.en:
The group named San Cayetano 2 is in its second loan cycle.

The committee is made up of women proud to get an improvement in quality of life for each of them; they have as a goal to overcome poverty in each indicator and completely. 

One of the members is Marciana, in whom the desire to improve herself stands out. She works at her job every day, which is making crafts. With the loan that she requests, she wants to purchase thread, needles, stretcher frames and more to be able to continue with making hammocks, bedspreads, and more. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to continue with her humble work.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, stretcher frames and more to be able to make crafts.

loans.name: Radik

texts.en: Radik with his parents and his brother live in the village Gagarin of Gegharkunik region. He is 33 years old and still unmarried. Radik is a worker at the private company but with all his family members he is engaged in farming. In the farm he takes care of cows, sheep and lambs. He has serious plans of developing his farming especially sheep breeding, as the sale of mutton is rather profitable for his family. Radik hopes that his request will be accepted and with the given Kiva loan amount he will buy two calves, two sheep and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves, two sheep and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a tea farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be hailstones which affect tea. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of tea. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.She will use the anticipated profits to buy a pick up.

loans.use: buy more stock of tea

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Now she lives with her daughter and mother-in-law. Her husband and son are in Russian Federation doing there abroad building works for more income for their family. Susanna started from 2000 till today established clothes trading business renting a stall for it at the city wholesale market. Susanna’s daughter is student at the paid division of Kapan branch Polytechnic Institute in future with specialty of economist. This loan of 400.000 Armenian Susanna needs in order to pay her daughter’s tuition fee and for this, both Susanna and her daughter are thankful beforehand.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to add M-pesa float. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family living standards.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables and also keeps dairy cows. Her business is located in a productive place and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be a large scale farmer. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Hoseah

texts.en: Hoseah is a married man. He has 4 children. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Nazani

texts.en: Nazani will soon end her first Kiva loan for which she is very thankful, and she harries to have her second deal as the first one was profitable and pleasant for her. Nazani is 27 years old and she lives in Darpas village of Lori region. Nazani runs accountancy of private company and she is still simultaneously engaged in the sale of cosmetics of a world known firm. From the sale of each product as previously she receives a percent and this is considered her salary. She likes both her occupations and now she thinks of her cosmetics sale development. This time she asks this loan for the purchase of computer, which will allow her to buy that cosmetics by the help of computer doing orders and repayments online. This will be very comfortable and quick.

loans.use: to buy that cosmetics by the help of computer doing orders and repayments online

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a tailoring business where he sells tailoring materials. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 75,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. He hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. she will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 30 years. Her business is located in an area with high customer inflow and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be a large scale distributor of fish within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorvehicle. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a suitable area and his primary customers are the general public. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service his motor vehicle. His business goal is to have more vehicles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service his motor vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is 59 years old and she lives in Zovaber village of Gegharkunik region. She graduated Sevan city’s trading college. Anahit lives with his husband (he works in abroad), daughter-in-law and her two grandchildren. Anahit’s son died 3 years ago because of car accident. Now for her son’s family care and needs Anahit and her husband do their best to provide them with love and good living conditions. Anahit used to work at the kinder-garden but now she is busy with farming only. In her farm she has a cow, a pig, piglets, heifers, sheep, lambs and chickens. She sells her farm products such as milk, macun (national dairy-product), curd, meat and eggs at the city wholesale market. She mentions that she wants to enlarge the assortment of her sold dairy-products and with this purpose Kiva loan she wants to use for buying one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: for buying one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport costs. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock clothes.

loans.name: Judity

texts.en: Judity is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells phone accessories. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are the general public. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of phone accessories

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sell fish. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are the general public. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be a supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough space to accommodate more customers. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more restaurant seats, renovate the restaurant. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more restaurant seats, renovate the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: o buy materials, equipment for making bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 53 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. He has a retail shop which he has been running for the past 6 years.

He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase more crates of soft drinks and packets of maize flour for sale and hopes this will enable him to make more income to support his family.

He plans to use generated profits to educate his children and buy more retail goods for sell. His future hopes are to expand his business, make more profits and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of soft drinks and packets of maize flour for sale and he hopes this will enable him to make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a single woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be transparent. She operates M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low M-pesa float. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add M-pesa float. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 51 years old, married and the mother of four children. She practices mixed farming of vegetables, potatoes and has also dairy cows. She used the previous loan to buy animal feeds and fertilizers that increased milk production and her crop yield.  She was able to earn more income which she used to pay part of her children's school fees.

She is now borrowing a second loan from Kiva to buy more animal feeds and fertilizer to further increase her income and continue paying school fees for her children.  She will also increase her milk production.

Lucy appreciates Kiva and her lenders for the continued financial support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more animal feeds and fertilizers to further increase her income and continue paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah was able to boost her salon business by buying materials such as shampoo, gel and hair weaves. Her business thrived due to improved services that led to more income and she was able to ensure food security in her house hold. She is borrowing a Kiva loan again to expand her business further by buying stock of hair gel , weaves and shampoo. She hopes this will help maintain the ever rising customer base. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon materials.

loans.name: King'atua Grazers Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Henry; He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the enterprise development and financial management training. He is 47 years old, married, and the father of 4 children.

He practices mixed farming growing vegetables and also keeps dairy cows.  He is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer for his vegetable farm to increase production, hence more income.  This will enable him take care of his family's expenses at ease.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his vegetable farm to increase production. Hence to earn more income to meet easily his family's expenses.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old and she supports 8 family members. 

She has been a farmer for the last 11 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she plans to use to purchase a cow for milk production as well as sales.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her children to higher levels of education. 
Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production as well as sales for her customers

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Benson is 35 years old and he supports 8 family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 6 years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase a cow for milk production. This will enable him to meet the growing demand for milk by his customers. 

He plans to use the gained profits to repay the loan and educate his children to higher levels of education.

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from training, especially on saving mobilization, enterprise development and financial management. She is 24 years old, married and blessed with two children. 

Ann operates a general retail shop and a greengrocer where she sells commodities like sugar,salt,milk, fruits and vegetables.  She is borrowing to buy more household items, fruits and vegetables to add stock to her general retail shop for increased income.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more household items, fruits and vegetables, so as to add stock to her general retail shop for increased income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado NIÑO JESUS 2 está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde las 18 mujeres luchan por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Otra de las integrantes es la Sra. Liliana quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir está en una pobreza extrema. Ella se dedica a la agricultura,  hace un tiempo, y comenta tiene ya muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos.
La Sra. Liliana pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas, abonos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su agricultura, y con ello poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en:
The group named Niño Jesus 2 is in their first cycle of the committee of women program, where everyone works and helps each other to succeed. They are doing the survey of poverty elimination, where 18 women struggle to be able to grow and succeed.

Another member is Ms. Liliana who in her latest survey showed a level of poverty in level one, which is to say that she is in extreme poverty. She makes a living in agriculture, a while ago, and says that she has a very good clientele who always buy her products.

Ms. Liliana is requesting this loan to be able to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other things, to be able to continue with her agriculture, and with this be able to give her family everything that she could not have.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other things for planting.

loans.name: Bathsheba

texts.en:
Bathsheba is 34 years old and supports a family of 5 members. 

She has been practicing coffee farming for the last 7 years, earning an income of KES7,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to expand her farming so as to raise more income to improve family living standards. 

She plans to use the profits raised to pay her loan and educate her children. 

Her future hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to expand her farming so as to raise more income to improve her family living standards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production and meet the demand of her customers and the needs of her family.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 4 children. He operates a retail business where he sells torch, polythene bags, umbrellas, radios and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in urban area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of radio, torches, umbrellas and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: buy more stock of radio, torches, umbrellas and other items

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
