Agnes is the widowed mother of five children, all of whom attend school. Agnes owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

Agnes has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door where passersby and town dwellers are her potential customers. She mentioned a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season, when it becomes difficult to operate her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to add to her savings and purchase a new motorcycle. Agnes joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 49-years-old and he supports eight family members. He has been a farmer for the last five years and the business earns him a monthly income of KES10,000. 

Samuel has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase a cow in order to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his customers daily. He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural produce. 

Samuel's hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his customers daily.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José tiene 39 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su tía que con mucho esfuerzo la apoya, ya que es una persona mayor de edad. Él se dedica a la venta  de pan francés desde hace 2 años, por lo que con su experiencia ha demostrado ser un hombre muy trabajador, respetuoso y amable con sus clientes. José necesita comprar una motocicleta ya que le servirá para poder  comercializar su venta, por lo que él está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar una motocicleta para realizar la venta de pan.
texts.en: José is 39 years old and lives in his own home together with his aunt who with much effort he supports, as she is an older person. He has made a living selling French bread for 2 years, for with his experiences he has demonstrated that he is a hardworking man who is respectable and kind with his customers. José needs to buy a motorcycle which will serve to market his sales. So he is requesting a loan from Fusai to buy a motorcycle for selling bread.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for selling bread.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 36 years old and he supports 5 family members.
 
He has been a farmer for the last 5 years and the business earns him a monthly income of 11,000 KES. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, with which he plans to purchase a cow for milk production and meet the demand of his customers and boost the agricultural sector. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural produce.
 
His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 51 years old and he supports 10 family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 15 years and the business earns him a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase a cow for milk production and meet the demand of his customers and boost his agricultural produce. 

He plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand his agricultural produce. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production and meet the demand of his customers and boost his agricultural produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Diana Senovia

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer trabajadora, honesta y emprendedora. Desde hace más de 10 años, inició con una pequeña pulpería en su hogar, y con el tiempo ha ampliado sus productos y ha ganado más clientes, convirtiendo su negocio en próspero y rentable.  

Por ello, solicita un nuevo financiamiento para  comprar granos básicos, shampoos, gaseosas, golosinas, jabones, etc. Lo cual le será de gran utilidad, porque ofrecerá mayor variedad de productos y con las ganancias podrá ampliar su casa.
texts.en: Diana is a hardworking woman who is honest and entrepreneurial. More than 10 years ago she started out with a tiny grocery store in her home and with time she has increased her quantity of products and has gained more customers, converting her business into something prosperous and profitable. Because of this, she is seeking a new loan to purchase basic foodstuffs, shampoos, sodas, sweets, soaps, etc. which will be very useful because she will offer a greater variety of products and with the earnings she will be able to increase the size of her home.

loans.use:
to purchase basic foodstuffs, shampoos, 
sodas, candies, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells milk, eggs, sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, cereals, milk and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will excel. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, cereals, milk and other items

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar,washing soap, cereals, milk and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are individuals. He will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, cereals, milk and other items. His business goal is to own  a wholesale shop within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to better his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cereals, milk and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming through the application of modern farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production for his customers and practice mixed farming as he meets the needs of those in his family.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 31, is married and supports 3 family members. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the last 6 years and the business earns him a monthly income of 7,000 KES. 

Moses has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenyato buy a dairy cow so that he can deliver milk on his motorcycle for more income. His hopes to use anticipated profits to repay the loan and to provide for his family.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so that he can deliver milk on his motorcycle.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old and he supports 6 family members. 

He has been a farmer for the last 15 years and the business earns him a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

He has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to use to purchase a cow for increased milk production to meet the demand of his customers and boost his agricultural activities. 

He plans to use his profits to repay the loan and expand his agricultural production. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for increased milk production to meet the demand of his customers and boost his agricultural activities.

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en: Vitalis is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells furniture. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of furniture. His business goal is to own a bigger shop within 5 years. This is his fourth  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: buy more stock of furniture

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary is a 49 years old and he supports 7 family members. 

He has been a dairy farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns him a monthly income of 11,000 KES. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya, which he plans to purchase a cow for milk production and increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his customers and meet their demands and family needs. 

He plans to use the profits he gains to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for milk production and increase the number of litres of milk supplied to his customers.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 46 years old and he supports 8 family members. He has been operating his cereal processing mill for the last 10 years and the business earns him a monthly income of 17,000 KES. 

Elijah has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to more liters of fuel to process cereal to meet his clients' demand. He plans to use his profits to repay the loan and expand his business. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more liters of fuel to use in processing cereal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lawi

texts.en: Lawi is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar,flour, sugar, salt and other items. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour , cooking fat and other items. His business goal is to have more retail shops within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour , cooking fat and other items

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
Santos, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está casado y su esposa es ama de casa, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian y el otro no estudia porque aún está pequeño, solo ellos viven en casa y económicamente dependen de él.

Santos, siempre se ha dedicado a la siembra de granos básicos, también al cultivo de hortalizas, todo lo aprendió desde pequeño, cuando se vio obligado a trabajar por la necesidad que sus padres tenían, fue así como decidió dedicarse a tiempo completo a este rubro, porque no tiene ningún nivel académico para poder aspirar a otro trabajo; su lugar de trabajo está a 10 minutos desde su casa.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar insumos agrícolas y para hacerle una mejora a su casita.

Santos, sueña con sembrar más hortalizas para obtener más cosechas, de esta manera obtendrá mejores ingresos y le dará una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, y con las ganancias de la venta de sus productos podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos is 33 years old. He studied until the 7th grade. He is married and his wife is a housewife. He has three children, two of whom are in school and the other is not in school because he is still little. He lives in his home with his family and they are economically dependent on him. 

Santos has always worked cultivating basic grains as well as vegetables. He learned his trade when he was very young when he was obligated to work because of the needs of his parents. This is how he decided to dedicate all of his time to this work because he did not have a level of education that could allow him to aspire to other work. The place where he works is 10 minutes away from his home. 

He will use this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and to complete an improvement to his home. Santos dreams of planting more vegetables to obtain more harvests in order to obtain better earnings and to be able to give a better quality of life to his family. He also would use the earnings from the sale of his products to complete improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and to complete an improvement to his home.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 29 years old and she supports five family members. 

She has been a farmer for the last five years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES 11,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which she plans to purchase a cow for milk production to meet the demand of her customers and boost her agricultural sector. 

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand her agricultural produce. 

Her hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production to meet the demand of her customers and boost her agricultural sector.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para tener reserva de una parte de la materia prima para su negocio durante el invierno, comprara leña y maíz para elaborar la venta de pupusas.
Con la buena utilización del crédito anterior Juana está mejorando su negocio y su situación económica es más estable.
texts.en:
Juana decided to seek a new loan to have a back-up of some of the main supplies for her business during the winter. She will buy wood and corn to sell her pupusas [stiffed griddle corn cakes].

By using her previous loan well, Juana is improving her business, and her financial situation is more stable.

loans.use: to buy wood and corn to make and sell pupusas [stuffed griddle corn cakes].

loans.name: Scolla

texts.en: Scolla is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a farm where she grows maize and also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. She will use the Kes 45,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer. She hopes that in the future, she will have stable income. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer

loans.name: St.charles Masaka School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is John. He is the Deputy Head teacher of St. Charles Masaka School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kasasa in Masaka with 550 students. St. Charles School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. 

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Charles School will repay the loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. John ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a farm where she grows maize and also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer. Her business goal is to have a stable farm within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of agrovet items

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, es padre de seis hijos, de los cuales cuatro estudian, uno está casado y el otro trabaja en casa.

Hilda, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, su madre le delego responsabilidades sobre sus hermanos pequeños, fue por esa razón que no pudo continuar estudiando.

Hilda, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, semillas y todo lo necesario para sembrar.

Hilda, sueña con ampliar su casa y comprar un terreno para cultivarlo y también quiere que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta que logren obtener un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Hilda is 52 years old. She studied up to second grade. She is married and her husband grows basic crops. They have 6 children, four of whom are studying, one is married and the other works at home. Hilda is  a housewife. Her mother used to delegate the care of her younger brothers and sisters to Hilda, which is the reason why she couldn't continue studying. 

Hilda needs the loan to buy agricultural consumables like compost, fertiliser, seeds and everything needed to plant crops.

Hilda dreams of extending her house and buying land to cultivate. She also wants her children to continue studying to university degree level.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables like compost, fertiliser, seeds and everything needed to plant crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bricks to complete the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water-filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the repair of his vehicle

loans.name: Corina

texts.en:
Corina is 41 years old. She sells spare parts in a store where she pays rent. Corina has her own house, but the place needs to be finished. 

Corina wants a loan to buy car lubricant to sell to her customers. In the future, Corina wants to finish the construction of her house. 

Also, Corina is the mother of three children whom she loves a lot, so she will do anything to help them. Corina is married, and her husband helps her with selling the spare parts. She has the chance to improve her business, and she is capable to do it.

loans.use: to buy car lubricant to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 32 years old, and she lives at her own house. She is married and has two daughters. 

Virginia is a seamstress who makes sportswear for children. Virginia's husband is a mason, but he doesn't make too much money.

She needs a loan to buy a sewing machine because she wants to improve her production. She also would like to make sportswear for adults. 

Virginia wants to have her own workshop in the future. She hopes you can help her. As you can see in the picture, she is working in the place where she sleeps, so that is uncomfortable.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in cement, wooden studs, wire, aluminum sheets and iron to replace her home's roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to replace her kitchen roof

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a rural farmer. He grows beans and maize on a not so large piece of land. He is, however, in a position to harvest enough for home use and sell part of the harvest. He also buys from other farmers at a relatively cheap price and sells to the those that are in need of them.

He would like UGX 500,000 to buy beans to supply a nearby school. 

Peter believes that his business will grow to a large scale. He appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for helping him to be enterprising. He is hard working and steady.

loans.use: To buy beans to sell

loans.name: Esther`

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 3 years. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a farm where she grows maize and also keeps livestock. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a productive land. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer. Her business goal is to have a stable farm within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is a 21-year-old young man from Tbilisi city. He lives with his pensioner grandmother, brother and uncle, who works at the food company and gets a fixed salary. To make a bit for his poor family's welfare, Otar started a private business. He opened a small shop of fruits and vegetables. 

Now he requires financial support to expand the business and purchase more products to continue running his business. Otar has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Otar and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

Otar is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate more income and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: To purchase more products and expand the business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes and clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Aleksandros

texts.en:
Aleksandros, who is 52 years old, lives in the village of Manglisi with his wife. They have a small agribusiness and cultivate a plot of agricultural land. The family lives in poverty, as they have no source of significant income and can't satisfy even basic needs. 

Aleksandros decided to start his own business locally and requested a loan. He has sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 5,000 GEL, and Aleksandros will use it to purchase a stock of food products and other necessary things for opening a general store. 

He will make business income, serve local people and have loyal costumers. 

The living conditions of the family will significantly increase because of Kiva lenders, and they will get the chance to make financial stability and a daily income.

loans.use: To open a general store and generate stable income

loans.name: Bechan

texts.en:
Bechan thanks once again all his Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice production. He has repaid his loan fully and on time and needs another loan of SRD 7,500 to purchase agricultural inputs such as diesel, fertilizers and pesticides. 

With the profits of last loan, he could save for the building of his future house.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to continue rice production

loans.name: Ivan Kobena

texts.en:
Ivan is a second-year student at the University of Cape Coast pursuing a Bachelor of Arts degree in business communication. He requested a loan, which he will use to help pay for his tuition fees. Here is his story:

I see myself in a position where I would be able to provide employment for the unemployed in several ways after the completion of my studies and positively affect the lives of family and country as a whole. As a young man, I have come to the realization that each individual has a purpose on earth and with this I never want to leave the earth without being able to fully accomplish my mission and goals. That is my inspiration.

I see myself owning several companies in the next five to 10 years to come. At my level I am able to solve pragmatic problems at home making me believe that the pursuant of my education will help me improve and be better person. If I am denied this loan, my performance will be affected because I would not have the needed peace of mind to concentrate on my studies .

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, re-bar and laminate sheeting to build a septic tank and a laminate sheeted room for it.

loans.name: País De La Maravillas Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Pais de Maravillas” (Country of Wonders) is requesting their first loan. There are seven women who make up the Trust Bank. They are looking forward to participating in in the “Microcredit Plus” educational program of Friendship Bridge.

Maria, one of the members is 30 years old. She wants to invest in her business selling typical Guatemalan clothing. Maria needs to buy more inventory of new and used clothing. She also wants to buy fabric to embroider, as well as to add lace for the blouses that are worn in her community.

Maria and the other members of “Pais de Maravillas” hope for a better quality of life. They are very appreciative of the non‐formal education program that the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank officer provides at their monthly meetings.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of new and used clothing

loans.name: Erick Alexander

texts.es: Erick tiene 26 años de edad y habita junto a su compañera de vida y una hija menor de edad, a la que desea darle lo mejor. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios como jornalero desde hace 11 años, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y sencillez es muy bien recomendado como un hombre trabajador y con deseos de superación. Erick desea hacer un cuarto de adobe y tejas en un terreno de su propiedad, por lo que él solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: madera, láminas, tejas y piedras para construir el cuarto para su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que desea brindar a su hija y compañera de vida un lugar propio donde vivir.
texts.en:
Erick is 26 years of age and lives with his life partner and an underage daughter who he wants to provide for in the best way possible. He has been making a living as a day laborer for the past 11 years and thanks to his experience and his simplicity he is very well recommended as a hard working man with a desire to succeed. 
Erick wants to make an adobe brick and shingle bedroom over a terrain on his property which is why he is requesting a FUSAI credit to invest in: wood, aluminum sheets, shingles and stones to build the room to be his residence. He wants to do this improvement as soon as possible because he wants to provide his daughter and life partner a place to live that's their own.

loans.use: invest in: wood, aluminum sheets, shingles and stones to build a bedroom for residence.

loans.name: Desiba

texts.en:
Desiba is a mother of seven children. At the aged of 57 she does vegetable gardening to help her husband to support their family needs. She decided to take a loan again to buy fertilizer for her vegetable garden to improve the harvest and have greater sales of vegetable in the market and thereby to increase their family income.

Desiba plans to save money out from her business to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for her vegetable garden.
